Are you looking to join the Navy sooner and fast-track your application? You can accelerate your career and start training in the next 3-6 months by applying for a priority role.
Whether you have recently finished school, currently studying, already in the workforce or you have no experience at all, we’re hiring. You’ll be paid from day one to gain all the skills needed with extensive on-the-job training. You may also be able to use your existing qualifications and be eligible for recognition of prior learning.
You’ll enjoy a competitive salary package, career stability, opportunities for continuous progression, and an adventurous lifestyle – all while making a difference to Australia.
Browse full-time priority roles below:
· Electronics Technician
Maintain, diagnose and repair state of the art technology and military hardware, onboard ships or submarines and ashore. You could be working with radars, sonars, satellite equipment, navigation aids, weapons systems, torpedo launchers and more.
· Marine Technician
Operate, monitor and maintain engineering systems and machinery to ensure equipment and technical systems onboard ships or submarines run at optimum capacity.
· Communications & Networks Operator
Be responsible for making sure communications and information is sent and received securely. Your duties include operating satellites, radios, IT and network systems, flashing lights (Morse code), flag signals and more.
· Weapons & Sensors Operator
Specialise in collecting and analysing sensor information and using combat data systems to make recommendations that inform tactical decisions and avoid potential threads.
Submariner:
There is also the option to specialise in some of these roles as a Submariner and be a part of the most exclusive and stable workforce in Australia. You will have a direct effect on Navy missions and operations at sea.
Benefits:
- Free medical and dental
- Competitive salary package
- Incremental salary increases as you progress through training and ranks
- 16.4% superannuation
- Job security
- Career progression and development
- Good work/life balance
- Travel opportunities
- Excellent social and fitness facilities
- Subsidised housing
- Balance of shore and sea postings
- Great chef made meals at sea
- Variety of allowances
Salary:
Upon completion of your initial military and employment training, you’ll enjoy a salary package starting from $75,451 for surface fleet and $88,437 for submariners.
Apply Now:
For these roles, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 with passes in English and Maths. Some positions may also require passes in Science.
Visit the link below for the full position descriptions:
https://navy.defencejobs.gov.au/priority-roles

Project Summary
Are you looking to make your mark with a world class, high-impact project?
Keen to join an experienced and highly respected team?
Want to contribute to significant environmental and cultural heritage values?

Then the Energy Resources of Australia (ERA) Ranger rehabilitation project is what you’re looking for!

After more than 35 years operating as a successful uranium mine, the Ranger Project is entering its rehabilitation stage and offers an exciting opportunity for you to make a positive impact on the environment.

ERA has engaged the global engineering firm, Bechtel, to support ERA as Delivery Partner for ongoing study work.

Bechtel will be working alongside ERA and major stakeholder Rio Tinto to restore the land to the status of its surrounding World Heritage listed Kakadu National Park. A collaborative project, this project will be developed in consultation with the Mirarr Traditional Owners and will benefit the Jabiru community.

Located 8 km east of Jabiru and 260 km south-east of Darwin, the Ranger Project will lead the way in the fast-growing area of mining closures.

This is your opportunity to join an established team, develop as a professional, and work in partnership with our client – contributing to a long-term commitment to people, communities and the environment.

Please note a formal offer to the successful candidate of this site-based FIFO (fly in fly out) position will be contingent upon passing a stringent medical examination.

Interested to learn more? Visit: Energy Resources of Australia Ltd (www.riotinto.com); Energy Resources of Australia (www.energyres.com.au)

Position Summary
As our Project ESH (Environment Safety and Health) Advisor you will be responsible for providing ESH advice and facilitating, promoting and coordinating activities related to ensuring the health and safety of all project participants is maintained for the duration of the ERA Ranger Rehabilitation Project.

You will champion ESH on site and continuously contribute to a positive safety culture - leading by example, coaching personnel and providing timely advice and support as required for the entire project workforce.

This role will be based on site at the Ranger Mine jobsite offices where you will be assigned on a fly in/fly out roster (2 weeks on, 1 week off) flying to and from Darwin - with a drive to the Jabiru work site - where camp accommodation is provided.

Key Responsibilities (include but are not limited to)
Provide technical support for site ESH assessments and project risk assessments including - Level 2 Risk Assessments, Job Hazards Analysis (JHA), review scopes of work for site ESH requirements
Contribute to readiness with timely notifications and actively participating in project 30/60/90-day planning
Contribute & coach improvement of HSE processes and procedures
Support the implementation of the Contractor HSE plan and ensure alignment in accordance with established polices, systems, processes, procedures and methods and regulations.
Participate in meetings with customers, project team members, and contractors/subcontractors to advise of project-specific mitigation plan, training program, and technical reports
Stop work in dangerous situations or conditions having imminent adverse ESH impact (i.e. person, plant & or equipment)
Assist in data collection and interpretation on project accident investigations; documents factors contributing to an incident and prepares required reports
Support inspection tours, audits of the project/facility for compliance with project ES&H requirements
Conduct fatigue assessments for the project workforce
Develop cross-training for personnel in professional or discipline-specific skills, techniques, and procedures
Support timely intervention of medical/first aid treatment and ensure contractors have effective stay at work programs for injured workers including alternate work duties.
Contribute to the project ESH orientation and training of project manual/non-manual personnel
Ensure contractor compliance in the implementation of environmental compliance inspections conducted to monitor compliance with environmental requirements including daily inspections and waste forecast and waste disposal
Validate effectiveness of COVID19 controls in work areas
Interpret applicable HSE standards and supervises implementation into work design and delivery
Complete timely report of contractor HSE performance as per project reporting requirements
Execute other HSE duties as assigned by supervisor, Site Manager, Project HSE Manager, or designated GBU ES&H management.

What we offer
There are many reasons why choosing to join Bechtel is one of the best career decisions you will ever make. In addition to working with talented, dedicated people and having the opportunity to play an integral role in stimulating and rewarding local and international projects, Bechtel is committed to offering employees the benefits and resources to live healthy lives.

With a competitive salary package and annual discretionary performance bonus scheme in place, employee wellbeing is also at the centre of our business - promoted through private health cover and includes access to specialist medical advice (‘Best Doctors’) and a leading employee assistance program.

We are serious about setting you up for success from the very beginning. Experience an established online onboarding process, gain access to learning and development opportunities via the Bechtel University and participate in our Talent Management and Reward and Recognition programs.

Qualifications and Skills
Formal qualifications in environmental and/or safety engineering, process safety, health or related discipline.
Demonstrated experience in construction or mining in a safety role with some experience in supervising small teams.
Working and applied knowledge of HSE sciences/engineering systems, principles, and methodologies.
Knowledge of and experience working within an Australian legislation context (e.g. interpreting and providing advice based on relevant OHS Acts & Regulations).
Knowledge of permitting processes and responsibilities, Industry standards for HSE compliance, and best management practices for minimising HSE impacts during project execution.
Knowledge of engineering and construction systems, methods and work processes, construction planning, estimating, procedures, and execution.
Exposure to project closure or rehabilitation projects preferred.
Offers of employment will be conditional upon successful completion of a medical examination (including but not limited to a functional exam and drug and alcohol testing).

Please note, Right to Work in Australia without employer sponsorship is required for this role.

Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. This is an opportunity for an agronomist to work with a flourishing business in the Bundaberg region across their multi-site farming system. A system that provides large scale production, innovative farming practices and high quality produce to local and international markets.
Who will you work for?
Over five decades, this farming business has not stopped growing. As farming practices, environmental management and tastes have changed; so too has our business. With over 100 years’ combined experience in horticultural science, engineering, marketing, business management, finance and accounting, our team is focused on sustaining this business through the opportunities and challenges of the next fifty years. Due to the expansion and growth they have achieved, they are looking for an agronomist to join the farm agronomy team and assist in continuing to improve the farming system.
The role itself?
This is an opportunity to join a fantastic farm services team. Your day to day activities in this role will include:
Carrying out the collection of required soil, leaf and root samples and work with the Agronomy Manager to make recommendations based on results and knowledge
Working with farm managers on techniques for improving crop production, tree health, controlling disease, pests and weeds, as well as nutrition improvements and management
Maintaining a recording system for nutrition and spray applications
Creating worksheets for chemical and nutrition applications as per advice. Ensure these are performed as directed in conjunction with the farm manager
Stocktaking and maintaining stock levels for upcoming chemical and fertiliser applications
Conducting weekly monitoring of pest and disease in avocados and mangoes
Researching and implementing new techniques and management systems for improving post –harvest quality, orchard health and yield
Evaluating the information gained from the library trays and pack out data to either maintain or further improve fruit quality for each block
Working with consultants to improve orchard productivity, tree health and fruit quality
Maintaining an understanding of current research and aid in implementing new production techniques in the business
Writing reports as required to support the Agronomy Manager and other Managers in the business
Supporting farm staff with spray equipment calibrations and ensure equipment calibration are up to date
What kind of person will fit the role?
The perfect person for this role will have tertiary qualifications in agronomy, proven knowledge and experience in avocados, macadamias, mangoes or citrus production. As you will be working as part of an established farm team, it is extremely important that you have an ability to communicate, collaborate and lead.
How will you be rewarded?
You will be rewarded for your contributions to the business with an attractive salary (proportionate to your experience and skill set), 10% superannuation, full use of a company vehicle and access to all home office equipment.

ROLE SUMMARY
The National Parks Association of Queensland Inc. (NPAQ) advocates for the protection, expansion and effective management of the protected areas in Queensland; offers a bushwalking and outdoor recreation activities program; and provides opportunities to participate in community conservation and citizen science projects.
NPAQ supports the development and application of scientific and professional knowledge in advancing national parks and nature conservation in Queensland.
Working closely with the NPAQ Council and its various committees, staff and volunteers, your role is to contribute to the achievement of NPAQ’s mission, the building of a sustainable future for NPAQ, and strengthening the Association’s funding base and public profile.
The role requires experience and/or specific capability in the following areas:
Fundraising
Marketing/promotions
Member/supporter attraction and retention
Grant writing
Research and data insights
Stakeholder relations
Communications and engagement
Accountabilities
The duties of the role will encompass, but not be limited to, those outlined below.
Key Accountabilities
Reviewing and critically assessing fundraising activities undertaken by NPAQ and other similar organisations, including (but not limited to):
Membership drives
Public appeals
Regular giving – members and supporters
Major donations
Bequests
Grants
Corporate sponsorship
Assisting with the development of a three-year fundraising strategy and action plan (2023-25), to enhance income outcomes for NPAQ.
Planning and implementing fundraising activities in line with the approved fundraising strategy and action plan.
Regularly monitoring, evaluating and reporting on the outcomes of fundraising activities.
Conceiving new and innovative fundraising opportunities, with supporting evidence.
Scoping out and applying for relevant grants to supplement NPAQ’s other fundraising outcomes.
Contributing content to key NPAQ Communications, including Neck of the Woods (monthly), Protected (four times per annum), NPAQ’s Annual Report and NPAQ’s website and social media channels.
Supplying relevant fundraising data and intelligence to inform marketing and promotional campaigns.
Sharing insights and tactics to help retain members, supporters and subscribers.
Other Accountabilities
Develop partnerships with key stakeholders and the broader fundraising community.
Assist in driving advocacy and public engagement to ensure organisational growth and relevance.
Participate in strategic and operational planning, team building and performance development.
Relationships
The role reports directly to the NPAQ Chief Executive Officer.
The role works closely with:
NPAQ Chief Executive Officer
NPAQ Operations Manager
NPAQ Conservation Manager
NPAQ Marketing and Engagement Committee
Other key relationships are:
NPAQ Council/Executive
NPAQ contractors and consultants
NPAQ members, financial supporters and online supporters
NPAQ sponsors, donors and grant-giving bodies
Other not-for-profit organisations involved in fundraising.
Special Conditions
Will be required to abide by the NPAQ Code of Conduct.
Some weekend and out of hours work may be required.
Inter and intra state travel as required.
A current driver’s licence is essential.
Selection Criteria
Essential:
Experience in the development and implementation of fundraising strategies, plans and campaigns to support ongoing financial sustainability and organisational growth.
Demonstrated success in donor stewardship strategies to engage, retain and grow a strong community of supporters and increase income.
Proven experience in applying for and securing grant funding.
Demonstrated knowledge of data-driven market insights, audience segmentation and user targeting.
Strong people skills and a flexible approach when working in a team.
Desirable:
A passion for protecting the environment.
At least three-years’ experience in not-for-profit fundraising working across multiple fundraising streams.
Excellent writing skills and experience in writing for appeals, digital communications, social media and websites.
Appropriate tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline such as Fundraising or Marketing or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and education/training.
This role description serves to illustrate the scope and responsibilities of the role and is not intended to be an exhaustive list of duties. You will be expected to perform other job-related tasks requested by the Chief Executive Officer, and as necessitated by the development of this role and the development of NPAQ.
How to Apply:
To apply for this role, please submit a cover letter (x1 page) explaining why you are interested in the role. Please include a response to how you meet the selection criteria, together with your Resume (x4 pages maximum).

Hexagon is a global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software, and autonomous technologies. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality, and safety across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector, and mobility applications.
Our technologies are shaping production and people-related ecosystems to become increasingly connected and autonomous — ensuring a scalable, sustainable future.
Hexagon’s Mining division solves surface and underground mine challenges with proven technologies for planning, operations, and safety.
Hexagon (Nasdaq Stockholm: HEXA B) has approximately 21,000 employees in 50 countries and net sales of approximately 4.6bn USD. Learn more at hexagon.com and follow us @HexagonAB.

Purpose of Position:
The Data Engineer is a key role for the delivery of Hexagon’s One Platform interoperable data vision. You will have a proven track record in data engineering, and you will have the opportunity to change an industry – to enable that industry to improve how it works with data across its entire value chain.
The Data Engineer responsibilities are:
Champion best-practice and drive adoption of Hexagon’s data standards.
Ensure data definitions are clearly defined and easy to consume.
Enable the delivery of data-interoperability across the entire mining industry value-chain.
Train software development and data science teams on application of the data standards.
Write and review new data definitions against data standards and advise required changes.
Ensure data definition classification, definition overlap and versioning is managed.
Identify and assist in defining new high-value data definitions for data science applications
Work with BI report developers to identify gaps or improvements to data definitions.
The role reports to the Product Manager, Data & Analytics and will work collaboratively with our global software development teams, product owners and product managers – to help the business realize value for our customers.

Major Areas of Responsibility:
General Strengths
Strong time management and prioritization skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
High level of personal drive and self-motivation.
Desire to expand own knowledge and skill set as well as share knowledge.
Communicate accurate progress and status of work.

Position progression aligned with the Skills Framework for the Information Age.
Level 1 – SFIA 4 – Enable
Level 2 – SFIA 5 – Ensure, advise
Level 3 – SFIA 6 – Initiate, influence
Knowledge & Experience Required:
Education / Credentials
A University qualification (Bachelor degree) in Computer Science, Engineering, Commerce, or a related qualification. Proven industry experience will be considered.
Critical Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Required Experience
Experience in developing or working with enterprise level data models.
Experience in collaboratively designing and developing large-scale data solutions.
Experience in defining standards for, writing, and driving technology and data documentation.
Experience providing mentoring and delivering training.
Understanding of the principles, tools and programs required for data engineering, reporting, analytics, visualization and/or machine learning.
Desirable Experience
Experience leading a data engineering team.
Demonstrated experience using data to increase efficiency and achieve business goals.
Understand the mining industry domain, industry requirements and relevant technologies.
Experience researching and testing data engineering theories to choose the best option.
Experience testing and deploying advanced data analysis tools and techniques such as algorithms and machine learning.
Experience automating processes.

At GenesisCare we want to hear from people who are as passionate as we are about innovation and working together to drive better life outcomes for patients around the world.
Do your life’s best work!
Here within our Auchenflower, Brisbane clinic, we have an exciting position for a Clinical Research Coordinator to join us on a full-time, permanent basis. You will be responsible for working closely with the Principal Investigators, Co-investigators and the GenesisCare Research Team to conduct clinical research activities through the coordination and delivery of both direct and indirect care and associated data collection for clinical trials.

You will ensure that all research is conducted in accordance with GenesisCare SOPs, Good Clinical Practice (GCP) Guidelines and all applicable national and international laws and regulations.
What’s in it for you:
Thriving close-knit culture and communities
Supportive environment with encouragement and challenge to live your highest potential both professionally and personally
To be part of the exciting transformation journey in healthcare and make a difference in our patients’ clinical and emotional needs
Ability to travel interstate, if required
Next to the beautiful Brisbane river, with many restaurant and bars close by

What you’ll do:
Attend Pre-Study and site initiation visits for allocated trials
Have a thorough understanding of all trials being conducted at your site, particularly the protocol, investigator brochure, participant information and consent forms, budget, timelines and safety reporting requirements
Establish and organise study files, including regulatory binders, study specific source documentation and other materials as required
Work with the Team Lead to develop and update patient recruitment plans and ensure recruitment targets and timelines are met
Work closely with the Team Lead and Investigators to manage day-to-day research activities
Liaise directly with patients to ensure they are aware of all trial related requirements and ensure they attend all trial related appointments and assessments
Be available to discuss any trial related queries with patients and liaise with investigators to ensure all questions and concerns are addressed
Schedule protocol specific assessments and procedures ensuring Investigators are available during study visits to perform required tasks
Liaise with and facilitate collaboration between relevant hospital departments and third parties to ensure the provision of quality clinical services
Prepare for and host monitoring and close out visits
Maintain all study related documentation and ensure data queries are completed in a timely manner
Complete all study close out activities including archiving of all study records
Maintain open and regular communication with key stakeholders, in particular sponsor representatives
Maintain up-to-date knowledge in regulatory, administrative and clinical frameworks and current clinical issues and practice as they pertain to research
Who you are:
An undergraduate degree deemed equivalent in Science, Nursing, Pharmacy or related disciplines
A minimum of 2 years’ experience in Nursing or science
A minimum of 2 years’ experience as a Study Coordinator/Clinical Research Coordinator
Strong computer literacy with knowledge of clinical trials software and MS Office suite
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team in an effective, pro-active and co-operative manner
High level of initiative and flexibility and the ability to meet deadlines while balancing multiple priorities
Who we are:
We are 5500+ highly trained healthcare professionals and support staff across Australia, the U.K., Spain, China and the United States, designing innovative treatments and care for people with cancer, heart and sleep disease.

Global care
Across the world, we have more than 440+ centres to help us bring the right care to our patients. For radiation therapy, that includes 14 centres in the UK, 21 in Spain, 36 in Australia and 300 in the U.S. We also offer cardiology and sleep services at more than 80 locations across Australia. Every year our team sees more than 400,000 people globally.

People centricity is at the heart of what we do—whether that person is a patient, a referring doctor, a partner or someone in our team. We aim to build culture of ‘care’ that is patient focused and performance driven. Our people promise is “do your life’s best work, by always growing, having a profound human impact and making great things happen together.” If you’d like to make a difference, join us at GenesisCare.

Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. And we’re back (in a big way).
We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. For us, flying is so much more than simply taking off and landing (although we understand that is quite important). It’s about going the extra mile, in the air and on the ground, to create authentic experiences that put our guests firmly at the heart of everything we do.
What you’ll be doing:
The Advanced Analytics Specialist position is an exciting role, with a lot of variety and breadth of work. It will give you the opportunity to grow and gain great exposure to different parts of the business. The areas span across Operations, Commercial (airfare pricing and Revenue Management), and econometrics, elasticity, and Network optimization.
Key accountabilities
Utilize a variety of statistical and analytic methods to generate data models to help predict and explain business and operational trends to senior leadership and other division stakeholders.
Perform ad hoc analysis to support multiple departments by compiling historical data as well as forecasting future trends.
Research and evaluate industry trends, practices, and operational methodologies to continually improve overall company operational philosophy and performance.
Validate and improve existing assumptions and processes; communicate informed conclusions and recommendations to senior leadership to improve business processes.
Champion a culture of business analytics and serve as a centre of excellence for trusted data integrity and analysis needs.
Support the Business Intelligence model by providing data analysis on key initiatives, and act as a data subject matter expert to align internal customer needs with IT technical requirements to ensure the BI infrastructure is robust and competitive.
You’ll be great in this role if you:
Minimum of three years’ experience in Advanced Analytics is desirable. Previous data science and operations research experience is desirable
An Engineering Consulting background or Management Consulting background could be advantageous
Ability to take mathematical concepts and communicate business relevance to key business stakeholders, from front-line operations up to executive level management
Ability to write database queries for successful data analysis
Use of machine learning on large data sets to identify drivers and make predictions
Creation of optimisation models to reduce cost and increase revenue
Advanced Excel based user, including Power Query & Powerpivot. Exposure to Modelling languages such as; R, Python, DAX, SQL, PowerBI.
Ability to create various predictive and operational models as required
Exposure to simulation models including Monte Carlo and Discrete Event is desirable
What you’ll get from us:
We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to);
Heavily discounted air travel for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
Flexible working arrangements (including work hours and work from home)
Discounts on travel insurance, car hire, accommodation and experiences worldwide
Discounted Virgin Australia Lounge membership
Hospitality, retail, technology, beauty services and wellness discounts
Wellness support, including the betterme digital wellbeing platform
A comprehensive Employee Assistance Program, which offers confidential coaching and support from qualified professionals for all aspects of life – physical, mental, social and financial
Dress for Your Day – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever is appropriate for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you
Equality rules
We’re all individuals. We love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.
COVID-19
The safety and security of our people, guests and operations come first. Always. That’s why we’ve put together a comprehensive ‘Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy’. In a nutshell, to work with us, you’ll need to comply with our (and the airport’s) rules and regulations. And be fully vaxxed.

Insights and Analytics Unit (IAU) | Sunshine Coast Campus

Full-time, Ongoing
About the Opportunity
Join our IAU in this newly created position to enable support and advocate for the success of strategic, operational, and tactical objectives which deliver value to the University community.
You will play a crucial role in assisting all areas of the University to excel in their activities through the provision of information, insights and analytics that enhance decision making.
Y*ou will*
lead the development and enhancement of services. This includes leading two specialised teams that provide a range of services, including multi-disciplinary insights and information analysis to support evidence-based decision making across the University;
advocate for the success of the Unit’s strategies and plans. You will act as a second in command across the full scope of Unit activities and functions, providing regular expert advice and support toward the achievement of the Unit’s objectives, engaging with staff and stakeholders across UniSC to underpin the leadership capability of the Unit; and
develop and enhance stakeholder relationships and service support to ensure the work of the Unit achieves its core objectives and impediments to success are adequately addressed. You will build a prominent internal profile, to ensure all senior, academic, and operational stakeholders are effectively engaged and that the Unit meets stakeholder expectations.
About University of the Sunshine Coast - UniSC
We’re a young, vibrant, and rapidly growing university with a focus on sustainability, impact and community. As one of Australia’s fastest growing universities, UniSC is ripe with opportunities for passionate, skilled and determined leaders who want to make an impact in higher education.
Our award-winning facilities span five campuses across Southeast Queensland, in regions renowned for their natural beauty, enviable lifestyles, diverse communities and rich cultural heritage. UniSC is the world’s only university operating within three UNESCO Biosphere Reserves and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
We are one of the most respected universities in Australia for our teaching quality, as acknowledged by our five-star rating in the Good Universities Guide - a title we have held for 17 consecutive years.
UniSC is recognised as a global leader in sustainability principles. Our strong commitment to achieving sustainability is embedded in our teaching, research and how we operate, as evidenced by the 2022 Times Higher Education (THE) Impact Rankings in which we are the top ranked Queensland university for ‘Overall Impact.’ UniSC is also ranked in the top three percent globally for 'Climate Action' impact, and third in Australia for our global impact to ‘Life on Land’. We’re in the top four percent globally for ‘Life Below Water’. These rankings are a welcome recognition of our research, teaching and stewardship work in these specialty areas.
We’re focused on becoming Australia’s most relevant university. This means our research explores the timeliest topics of our era, those with the most significance for the future. We have 26 research fields ranked at – or well above – world standard according to the most recent Excellence in Research for Australia Rankings.
UniSC’s national and international research impact continues to grow exponentially. Since 2013, we have more than tripled our annual research income, and this is just the start of our story. We are young, ambitious, and determined to become Australia’s premier regional university.
We warmly encourage you to join us on this journey.
About you
To succeed in this role you will be an exceptional communicator with the ability to foster high-performing teams. You will relish the opportunity to translate strategic objectives into operational activities, using lateral influence to achieve successful results.
You will possess:
extensive experience and applied knowledge in the development and delivery of insights, expert analysis, forecasting and quantitative planning to drive strategic and operational outcomes;
knowledge of contemporary organisational strategy, performance analysis, data analytics, and information management practices of large and complex organisations, and experience in delivering leading approaches which drive innovation in institutional and business performance;
strong understanding and experience in the higher education sector, or the ability to quickly learn and apply knowledge to meet government and state performance analysis and quality assurance requirements; and
ability to find creative ways to solve problems, innovate and lead change to improve business processes.

Project Overview:
Are you looking to make your mark with a world class, high-impact project?
Keen to join an experienced and highly respected team?
Want to contribute to significant environmental and cultural heritage values?

Then the Energy Resources of Australia (ERA) Ranger rehabilitation project is what you’re looking for!

After more than 35 years operating as a successful uranium mine, the Ranger Project is entering its rehabilitation stage and offers an exciting opportunity for you to make a positive impact on the environment.
ERA has engaged the global engineering firm, Bechtel, to support ERA as Delivery Partner for ongoing study work.

Bechtel will be working alongside ERA and major stakeholder Rio Tinto to restore the land to the status of its surrounding World Heritage listed Kakadu National Park. A collaborative project, this project will be developed in consultation with the Mirarr Traditional Owners and will benefit the Jabiru community.

Located 8 km east of Jabiru and 260 km south-east of Darwin, the Ranger Project will lead the way in the fast-growing area of mining closures.

This is your opportunity to join an established team, develop as a professional, and work in partnership with our client – contributing to a long-term commitment to people, communities and the environment.

**Please note a formal offer to the successful candidate of this site-based FIFO (fly in fly out) position will be contingent upon passing a stringent medical examination.

Interested to learn more? Visit: Energy Resources of Australia Ltd (riotinto.com); Energy Resources of Australia

Position Summary:
Based working out of Jabiru (working a 2 week on 1 week off roster), under minimal supervision, our project Occupational Hygienist will be responsible for implementing and administering project industrial hygiene programs affecting employee, public safety and occupational health.

You are a key asset to the project line management - administering a proactive prevention program for occupational accidents and illnesses.

This role will require you to perform moderately complex technical work in a wide range of industrial hygiene disciplines to achieve compliance with ES&H standards along with federal and state regulatory requirements.
This is your chance to use your knowledge and experience to develop, implement and maintain industrial hygiene programs, systems and procedures; as well as monitor and prevent hazards and diseases that may be found in the work area.

Investigating accidents, injuries, and complaints concerning hazards in the workplace and recommending improvements in processes, design, procedures and operating equipment to minimize hazards will also form part of your role.

Key Responsibilities (include but are not limited to):
Complete risk assessments of potential occupational health hazards
Develop and maintain an occupational hygiene profile for the project
Establish and maintain the occupational hygiene record system for the project
Establish necessary interfaces, resources and tools for occupational hygiene activities
Develop, implement and provide oversight for the occupational hygiene program
Develop and conduct employee training
Coordinate with leaders on risk controls associated with occupational health risks
Promote compliance with programs, regulations, permits, approvals and requirements
Provide occupational hygiene training
Communicate information about occupational health hazards
Determine the OELs for the workplace
provides regulatory interpretation and technical advice
Seek technical guidance when OELs are unavailable
Apply the OELs to occupational health hazards
Conduct occupational exposure assessments to the defined schedule
Maintain instruments and other equipment required for sampling and assessment
Review contractor OHRA for work scopes and provide technical recommendation for managing work safely
Train and assist junior ESH personnel in sampling and collection methodologies.
Conduct and assist the project with sampling, monitoring, data interpretation and occupational health surveys to ensure compliance with established programs.
Provide regulatory interpretation and technical advice; may provide guidance for a team of ES&H specialists and/or support personnel.

What we offer
There are many reasons why choosing to join Bechtel is one of the best career decisions you will ever make. In addition to working with talented, dedicated people and having the opportunity to play an integral role in stimulating and rewarding local and international projects, Bechtel is committed to offering employees the benefits and resources to live healthy lives.

With a competitive salary package and annual discretionary performance bonus scheme in place, employee wellbeing is also at the centre of our business - promoted through private health cover and includes access to specialist medical advice (‘Best Doctors’) and a leading employee assistance program.

We are serious about setting you up for success from the very beginning. Experience an established online onboarding process, gain access to learning and development opportunities via the Bechtel University and participate in our Talent Management and Reward and Recognition programs.

Qualifications and Skills
BS/MS in Occupational Safety, Occupational Health, Industrial Hygiene, or related science or engineering field and solid experience in a construction environment. In lieu of a degree, extensive relevant experience in a construction environment.
AIOH Certification Required.
Offers of employment will be conditional upon successful completion of a medical examination (including but not limited to a functional exam and drug and alcohol testing).

Please note, Right to Work in Australia without employer sponsorship is required for this role.

Shaping tomorrow together
Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. Liquid is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join the team in an exciting new chapter in digital product analytics and data-driven innovation for our clients. This role will see you use your technical and analytics expertise to translate user, product, business or other data into information and insights to support the company and our clients to help solve complex problems.
We are a digital agency that prides itself on solving complex problems and creating new opportunities. Sometimes that’s transforming how an organisation works and the services it delivers. Often, it's tackling difficult social challenges like mental health, aged care or education. Always, it’s as a trusted part of the client team.
We apply creative and technical expertise to produce digital products and strategic solutions, supported by reliability, consistency, and data-driven reporting valuable to our clients.
You can read more about our work here.
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for planning, maintaining, and implementing data collection methods (eg product or website tracking from Google Analytics), analysis and data presentations (eg Tableau dashboards), ensuring that current best practices are applied.
You will also be required to continuously evaluate and review data analysis and performance analytics methods and platforms to maintain data integrity in the organisation. This often means treading into new territory defining measurement and evaluation plans on greenfield digital solutions. It also needs to be backed up by ongoing reliability, consistency and effectiveness of data-driven reporting and insights that are easily consumable and highly valuable to our clients.

You will need to show a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a Data Analyst or similar role. This is a new role and will form an important part of the Health and Government team working on major long term transformation projects. Experience in health, government or public data would be highly regarded.

Core responsibilities of the role include:
Engage with stakeholders to understand, scope, and document data and website tracking requirements to contribute towards continuous product improvement
Advise stakeholders on best practice data collection methods, tools, and technologies
Generate and execute data collection and analysis strategies to contribute towards product performance reporting
Identify new sources of data, as well as new methods for analysing existing data sources, for us to include in dashboards, and data analysis and reporting products
Monitor performance and quality control plans to identify process improvements
Vizualise, analyse, and report complex data for stakeholders so that key business questions can be answered quickly and easily
Contribute to the shaping of strategies through analysis of business trends and customer behaviours
Identify and suggest product improvements based on data insights and patterns
Prepare data reports suitable for specified audiences based on pre-defined objectives
Present data insights to internal and external teams

To be successful you’ll need:
Understanding of data analysis and performance analytics methods & techniques
Experience in Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Qualtrics, Tableau and Excel
Knowledge and experience of marketing principles, channels and tracking methods
Knowledge and ability to define, measure, report and debate on common product metrics such as NPS, churn rate, DAU/MAU & CLTV
Ability to multitask and work on more than one project/client
Ability to work to timelines including deadlines, milestones, and check-ins
Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team
Strong communication skills, specifically being able to listen, analyse and act on the needs of the development team and external stakeholders
Confidence and professional presentation skills to build trusting relationships and rapport with clients and external stakeholders
An adaptable and experimentation mindset with a commitment to continuous improvement
Knowledge of enterprise level data and analytics methods, platforms and processes

Advantageous, but not essential:
Tertiary qualification with strong foundation in statistics or maths, such as a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or Finance
Experience in any or all the following: Power BI, R, Python and machine learning/predictive modelling
Proven ability to deliver government projects aligned to the DSS standards and WCAG Accessibility standards
Relevant certification, e.g. Google Analytics
Experience working with Sitecore
Experience working with GovCMS or the drupal platform
Experience with CDPs such as Snowflake, and integration with Azure
Experience with GA4 implementation

Project Summary
Are you looking to make your mark with a world class, high-impact project?
Keen to join an experienced and highly respected team?
Want to contribute to significant environmental and cultural heritage values?

Then the Energy Resources of Australia (ERA) Ranger rehabilitation project is what you’re looking for!

After more than 35 years operating as a successful uranium mine, the Ranger Project is entering its rehabilitation stage and offers an exciting opportunity for you to make a positive impact on the environment.

ERA has engaged the global engineering firm, Bechtel, to support ERA as Delivery Partner for ongoing study work.

Bechtel will be working alongside ERA and major stakeholder Rio Tinto to restore the land to the status of its surrounding World Heritage listed Kakadu National Park. A collaborative project, this project will be developed in consultation with the Mirarr Traditional Owners and will benefit the Jabiru community.

Located 8 km east of Jabiru and 260 km south-east of Darwin, the Ranger Project will lead the way in the fast-growing area of mining closures.

This is your opportunity to join an established team, develop as a professional, and work in partnership with our client – contributing to a long-term commitment to people, communities and the environment.

Please note a formal offer to the successful candidate of this site-based FIFO (fly in fly out) position will be contingent upon passing a stringent medical examination.

Interested to learn more? Visit: Energy Resources of Australia Ltd (www.riotinto.com); Energy Resources of Australia (www.energyres.com.au)

Position Summary
As our Project ESH (Environment Safety and Health) Coordinator and Onboarding Advisor you will be responsible for providing ESH advice and facilitating, promoting and coordinating activities related to ensuring the health and safety of all project participants is maintained for the duration of the ERA Ranger Rehabilitation Project.

You will champion the onboarding of contractors to the Project ESH site requirements and ensure contractors audits and reviews are scheduled accordingly. Within this role you will continuously contribute to a positive safety culture - leading by example, coaching personnel and providing timely advice and support as required to the contractor and the project ESH Team.

This role will be based on site at the Ranger Mine jobsite offices where you will be assigned on a fly in/fly out roster (2 weeks on, 1 week off) flying to and from Darwin - with a drive to the Jabiru work site - where camp accommodation is provided.

Key Responsibilities (include but are not limited to)
Work with Contracts team to ensure contractors are project ready
Establish the contractor onboarding schedule
Ensure contractor completes all prerequisites in relation to site mobilisation
Support handover to ESH site-based team
Provide technical support for site ESH assessments and project risk assessments including - Level 2 Risk Assessments, Job Hazards Analysis (JHA), review scopes of work for site ESH requirements
Contribute to readiness with timely notifications and actively participating in project 30/60/90-day planning
Contribute & coach improvement of HSE processes and procedures
Support theimplementation of the Contractor HSE plan and ensure alignment in accordance with established polices, systems, processes, procedures and methods and regulations.
Participate in meetings with customers, project team members, and contractors/subcontractors to advise of project-specific mitigation plan, training program, and technical reports
Assist in data collection and interpretation onproject accident investigations; documents factors contributing to an incident and prepares required reports
Supportinspection tours, audits of the project/facility for compliance with project ES&H requirements
Develop cross-training for personnel in professional or discipline-specific skills, techniques, and procedures
Support timely intervention of medical/first aid treatment and ensure contractors have effective stay at work programs for injured workers including alternate work duties.
Contribute to the project ESH orientation and training of project manual/non-manual personnel
Ensure contractor compliance in theimplementation of environmental compliance inspections conducted to monitor compliance with environmental requirements including daily inspections and waste forecast and waste disposal
Interpret applicable HSE standards and supervises implementation into work design and delivery
Complete timely report of contractor HSE performance as per project reporting requirements
Execute other HSE duties as assigned by supervisor, Site Manager, Project HSE Manager, or designated GBU ES&H management.

What we offer
There are many reasons why choosing to join Bechtel is one of the best career decisions you will ever make. In addition to working with talented, dedicated people and having the opportunity to play an integral role in stimulating and rewarding local and international projects, Bechtel is committed to offering employees the benefits and resources to live healthy lives.

With a competitive salary package and annual discretionary performance bonus scheme in place, employee wellbeing is also at the centre of our business - promoted through private health cover and includes access to specialist medical advice (‘Best Doctors’) and a leading employee assistance program.

We are serious about setting you up for success from the very beginning. Experience an established online onboarding process, gain access to learning and development opportunities via the Bechtel University and participate in our Talent Management and Reward and Recognition programs.

Qualifications and Skills
Formal qualifications in environmental and/or safety engineering, process safety, health or related discipline.
Demonstrated experience in construction or mining in a safety role with some experience in supervising small teams.
Working and applied knowledge of HSE sciences/engineering systems, principles, and methodologies.
Knowledge of and experience working within an Australian legislation context (e.g. interpreting and providing advice based on relevant OHS Acts & Regulations).
Knowledge of permitting processes and responsibilities, Industry standards for HSE compliance, and best management practices for minimising HSE impacts during project execution.
Knowledge of engineering and construction systems, methods and work processes, construction planning, estimating, procedures, and execution.
Exposure to project closure or rehabilitation projects preferred.
Offers of employment will be conditional upon successful completion of a medical examination (including but not limited to a functional exam and drug and alcohol testing).

A career at Arup offers you the chance to make a positive difference in the world. Independently owned and independently minded, we attract a diverse mix of people to work on ground-breaking global projects. Being a global team means we value people with diverse experiences, backgrounds, specialisms, and skills.
Our Digital Technology team are proud winners of the IT Team of the Year for 2021 at the Chartered Institute of IT’s UK IT Industry Awards.
We are looking for a junior EDMS support administrator to work within a dynamic team supporting our essential project platforms and tools that are used by our global engineering project teams across the built environment. Essential platforms types include; Electronic Document Management Systems (EDMS), Common Data Environments (CDE), and the application of Building Information Modelling (BIM).
The global technical software services team designs, delivers, operates, and supports the advanced engineering software and platform used by Arup’s engineers to deliver world-class outcomes to our clients.
You will play an integral role in supporting our project teams across the region that use our cloud platforms such as Microsoft SharePoint, Bentley ProjectWise, and Autodesk’s Construction Cloud platforms.
With supervision and guidance, your primary role will involve working closely with project teams and business leaders designing and implementing solutions that support project delivery, automating and streamlining our operations and processes. You will assist with the day-to-day running and maintenance of Arup’s EDMS solutions combining processes, practices, and tools whilst directly supporting engineering projects and teams. The role reports to the global head of technical software services, based in Brisbane.
"Arup is a firm built on delivering amazing projects and I really enjoy working closely with colleagues in the business to help them get them most out of technical software. It is always a great feeling to know we have supported engineers to resolve any technical issues and ultimately help them meet their deliverables and deadlines. Getting things done is always a team effort, so I’m constantly learning and developing from others.”
Lisa Chan, Australia

You have an understanding of, or are motivated to learn how to apply BIM and EDMS solutions on engineering projects

Operational support of Bentley ProjectWise and Autodesk’s Construction Cloud platform to support project and business requirements
Liaise directly with Project Directors/Managers, BIM Managers, and other project personnel to understand complex project requirements, develop appropriate technical solutions

Collaborate, coordinate, and provide support services to technical software service teams in other regions providing support, collaborating and knowledge sharing
Keep up to date with software products, trends, and supplier changes. Understand the vendors roadmaps, upcoming releases, new functionalities, and capabilities, liaising closely with the Strategic Partnerships team to promote and share knowledge across the business
Be a part of trials and pilots of updates and new technical services to meet the needs of the business
Design, produce and deliver training to the business community

Design and collaboration

Develop data pipelines and processes for data mining, data modelling and enterprise grade reporting and analytics solutions
Work closely with different business sectors to understand their data needs, and develop solutions that support the overall data and analytics strategic direction and self-service access to data assets

About the role
Reporting to the Quality Manager, the Laboratory Supervisor will be required to effectively lead the Quality Assurance Team and be responsible for the day to day running of the Laboratory. The role is also responsible for overseeing laboratory sampling and testing, entry of test results (external and internal) and release of finished goods and raw material batches. The role also oversees the implementation and practice of laboratory programs and Food Safety and Quality procedures.
Location: Australia, Murarrie.
Key responsibilities
Manage, plan and direct the wet and dry laboratories to ensure lab testing provide the highest quality analytical support for manufacturing while ensuring compliance with protocols, GMP and safety regulations.
Direct the work activities of the finished product / raw material to ensure that testing and release activities are executed in a timely and compliant manner.
Manage and scheduling/ rostering for Laboratory personnel when required (including weekends).
Execute and approve all laboratory investigations, sampling, and testing (including customer complaint investigations).
Review and investigate all out of spec (OOS) finished product and conduct trending analysis to assist in investigations.
Creation of SOPs where required for training purposes for direct reports.
Provide leadership, management, evaluation and training to all laboratory employees.
Maintain laboratory productivity by monitoring workload of direct reports and making staffing adjustments where required.
Design, develop and implement Laboratory training programs.
Communicate and supply testing results with the Operations and Supply Chain Team.
Supervise workers engaged in inspection and testing activities to ensure high productivity testing is completed in the allocated time.
Oversee raw materials clearance is completed in a timely manner – ensure COAs are received and reviewed prior to release.
Consolidate and provide accurate data for end of month (EOM) reporting for submission to the Food Safety Team.
Provide month end reporting data (EMP and finished goods) accurately to Quality Manager and Quality Systems Manager by the required deadline.
Qualifications and skills

Degree in Food Science/Technology or related discipline.
Working knowledge of food laws – must have prior relevant experience in the food industry.
Understanding of product certification programs such as Kosher and Halal.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Exceptional Leadership skills with well-developed coaching and mentoring skills.
Building high performing and effective teams.
Ability to drive continuous improvement and change management initiatives.
Knowledge of BRC, SQF, WQA, AQIS, HACCP and GMP.
Demonstrated ability to solve problems in a factory environment.
SAP knowledge.

At Fortescue Future Industries (FFI) we are leading the global energy transition by developing a portfolio of renewable energy and green hydrogen projects.

Manufacturing Quality Control Engineer

Work Location: Gladstone, QLD
Roster: Monday to Friday

Establish and maintain a quality culture within Fortescue Future Industries (FFI), by ensuring our production processes comply with company’s quality objectives and to implement continuous improvement. To achieve this, you will be hands on assuring and controlling quality with systems, tools and teams to exceed customer expectations while ensuring sustainable operations.

Deploy and support a quality culture within local FFI, by assuring and controlling quality with systems, tools and teams to exceed customer expectations while ensuring sustainable operations
Supports and maintains the Quality Management System and all aspects managed in line with FFI guidance

Lead the local teams in the application of an operational approach and system of process management that is continually evaluated for effectiveness

Performs audits and uses quality data analytics from all parts of the operation to identify risks, failures and non-conformances within the local operations, its suppliers and customers

Demonstrated experience delivering quality-focused outcomes in a mass production manufacturing environment
Experience using QA software tools and processes and automatically controlled processes
Desirable - Proven experience in an auditing role under ISO9001 or equivalent
Desirable - Demonstrated experience to work independently within stringent EH&S measures
Desirable - Certificate or Diploma in Auditing for ISO9001 system or equivalent

2023 Digital/IT Graduate
Kickstart your professional career with Origin
Brisbane based opportunity

A great Origin opportunity

Together we’re powering a cleaner, smarter energy future for Australia and beyond, always looking for better ways to deliver for our customers – and for our people.

Good energy starts with you, our great people.

THE ROLE
The Origin Graduate Program focuses on the professional development of recent graduates who are able to adapt to the changing needs of our business, providing you with the opportunity to apply your knowledge in practice with an industry leader.

It’s a structured three-year program, commencing February 2023, which provides discipline-specific learning opportunities including job rotations, mentoring and professional and technical development.

The program will give you the opportunity to gain experience on a range of projects, developing your technical and interpersonal skills to become a future technical or people leader.

IS THIS YOU?
We're looking for talented Digital/IT graduates who work collaboratively, are adaptive to change and are ready to be challenged. You’ll have strong communication and problem-solving skills and the ability to work with a diverse range of stakeholders across both office and site locations.

As a high performing recent graduate (within two years) you’ll have a degree in the related disciplines of Information Technology, Computer Science/Software or Data Science, and be interested in areas such as dev ops, application development, building data bases, automation or cyber security.

You’ll have a strong focus on continuous improvement and innovation, effective interpersonal skills and exposure to leadership through extra-curricular activities. But it’s your passion for the energy sector that will make you stand out from the crowd!

You must hold Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency (PR) to be eligible for this opportunity, and be available to start full-time work in February 2023.
Origin - Where good change happens

At Origin, we’re powered by people who believe in creating collective change. We’re creating more diverse and inclusive workplaces for everyone because the more perspectives we have, in a place where everyone can belong, the better we can tackle our challenges together. We are united, yet unique.

We are committed to fostering a diverse, gender equitable workforce, where all applications are evaluated on merit and potential. Anonyome Labs is creating a world in which people have exclusive control over their personal data.

In developing the Sudo digital identity at the heart of our products, we wanted to do something that hasn’t been done before — because that’s what the global fight for data privacy will demand from us all: out of the box thinking and .

We are looking for experienced developers to join our iOS team, responsible for architecting and developing our next generation of Sudo mobile apps for the global consumer market. You will be joining a high powered experienced team, following agile development principles, and who value well-designed software, creative thinking and thrive on solving the unsolvable. You will be working on technology spanning mobile communications (voice, messaging, email), and fintech/payments all underpinned by strong security and privacy principles.
This is a fantastic opportunity to work at a well established global start-up, working with some of the global leaders in the security and privacy space located in our local Gold Coast development lab and US headquarters.

Degree in Computer Science or related field

Experience implementing and maintaining unit tests

Strong communication skills

Australian citizenship or permanent residency

Institute for Social Science Research
Research Academic Level C
Full-time, Fixed-term position for up to 3 years
Applications close 9 January 2023 at 11.00pm AEST (R-20141)
About This Opportunity
The Institute for Social Science Research has an exciting opportunity available for an experienced Senior Research Fellow. The Institute’s mission to undertake transformational solution-focused research to address new and emerging challenges facing Australian society. ISSR is not a traditional academic organisational unit – it is largely self-funded with a strong focus on Category 2 and 3 contract research and Consultancy, which is used to build the workforce and support the research activity. All research staff are required to contribute to the contract research and Consultancy activities.
This position will make significant contributions to advancing social policy research leadership, by designing, researching, and evaluating place-based policy interventions to tackle the multiple dimensions of socio-economic disadvantage and social exclusion for vulnerable populations and communities. The successful candidate will have strong theoretical knowledge in social policy and evaluation, demonstrated policy research or practitioner experience in academic and/or government or the private sector (service sector, NGOs), and advanced communication skills. The position will be required to build a research profile aligned with the themes of solution-oriented research, and to lead and contribute to contract research opportunities and collaborate with internal and external partners to influence policy making, program development and implementation.
Research
Provide strategic leadership in advancing the Institute’s approach to the social science of policy and practice to ensure high quality research methodology and collaboration that informs design, implementation, and impact of projects.
Develop and lead a strong externally engaged research program which contributes to the Institute’s key social science impact area of policy and practice.
Attract funding through a diverse portfolio of research contracts, grants, and other activities, with a major focus on Category 2 and 3 sources, to support research in collaboration with UQ and non-university partners.
Undertake high level project management of moderate to complex commissioned policy projects to ensure they are managed effectively and delivered on time, within budget and to a high standard.
Ensure high quality research outputs, including the delivery of contract research, reports for external partners and publishing in high quality journals.
Ensure that projects are delivered in compliance with all relevant contractual, regulatory and policy requirements, including ethics, integrity, privacy, data security and intellectual property obligations.
Collaborate with internal and external research partners, including contribution to the Institute’s business development.
Participate in and initiate activities such as research training workshops, seminars and conferences.
Teaching
Where undergraduate, postgraduate, or professional development teaching or training is undertaken, achieve teaching quality as indicated by approved surveys and outcomes for students/participants, and improve or innovate where appropriate in response to feedback.
Supervision and Researcher Development
Act as Principal and Associate Supervisor to Higher Degree by Research students.
Lead the facilitation of engagement opportunities for supervisees.
Effectively lead and develop employee performance and conduct by providing feedback, coaching.
Manage staff effectively throughout the employee lifecycle in accordance with University policy and procedures.
Working to promptly resolve conflict and grievances when they arise in accordance with University policy and procedure.
Citizenship and Service
Consistently demonstrate behaviours that align to the UQ values and Leadership Framework.
Contribute to UQ and ISSR’s key governance committees.
Develop and maintain strong strategic and value-adding relationships with industry research partners, government departments, professional bodies, community groups, as well as philanthropic supporters.
Work with internal and external partners to share knowledge and identify problems and solutions of common interest that can contribute to innovative, high-impact research projects.
Engage with relevant disciplinary and professional communities and other relevant external organisations as appropriate.
Contribute to strategic planning in the Institute and contribute to the training and development of staff and external stakeholders.
Perform a range of Institute and University level administrative functions, as required to support your activities.
Represent the Institute inside and outside the University as appropriate.
Any other duties as reasonably directed by your supervisor.
The position is located at the UQ Long Pocket Precinct only 10 minutes from the St Lucia campus, on Meiers Road, Indooroopilly (less than 10km from the Brisbane CBD).
This role is subject to The University’s
Code of Conduct
.
About You
A research doctorate (PhD) or industry equivalent in social or behavioural sciences, particularly public policy or administration.
Demonstrated research leadership in the theory and practice of social policy as it relates to vulnerable populations and communities.
A rigorous understanding of social policy theory and practices, and extensive demonstrated experience in the development and implementation of policy projects that contribute to research impact.
A strong commercial orientation and demonstrated experience in the development, management, and delivery of contract research or consulting projects – including contract negotiations.
Demonstrated ability to lead and deliver on a diverse portfolio of research projects, including the ability to manage multiple tasks in a highly productive environment with competing priorities and time pressures due to external deadlines.
Demonstrated ability to establish effective relationships and varied stakeholders, including with academia, industry, government and professional bodies.
An established track record of securing diverse sources of external funding to support your work, including experience of securing funding from government, industry and service sources.
An established track record of publication in high-ranking refereed journals and/or an established track record of production of non-traditional research outputs with demonstrable end-user relevance and value.
High level of written and verbal communication skills, including demonstrated experience in leading proposals and analytical reports, and the ability to present and translate information to diverse audiences.
What We Can Offer
This is a full-time, fixed term position for up to 3 years at Academic Level C.
The full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $128,109 - $147,717 plus super of up to 17%. The total FTE package will be in the range $149,888 - $172,830 per annum.
For further information about UQ’s benefits, please visit
Why Work at UQ
and review

.

Who are we looking for?
Queensland University of Technology (QUT) is seeking a Research Fellow in Cyber Security to join School of Computer Science, Faculty of Science, Academic Division.
The School of Computer Science at QUT is looking to recruit a Research Fellow in Cyber Security (Academic Level B). This position will contribute to a major research project on software security funded by the Cyber Security Cooperative Research Centre (CSCRC), and involves collaborating with CSCRC industry partners and other participant universities throughout Australia. The project is SOCRATES: Software Security with a Focus on Critical Technologies.

Real world impact
QUT is a major Australian university with a global outlook and a 'real world' focus. We are an ambitious and collaborative institution that seeks to equip our students and graduates with the skills they will need in an increasingly disrupted and challenged world.
About the Faculty
The Faculty of Science aims to explore the frontiers of our physical and digital worlds to drive innovation and develop solutions to complex, real-world challenges. We deliver distinctive programs in Information Technology, Mathematics and Science to meet industry demands for data-driven and technological solutions.
Strong connections and long-standing partnerships with governments and industry enable us to address complex challenges though learning, teaching, research, and innovation. We facilitate learning that is delivered on campus, online and in the real-world through relevant and practical learning experiences.
Our Schools are established around disciplines that promote collaboration in teaching and research. These include:
School of Biology and Environmental Science
School of Chemistry and Physics
School of Computer Science
School of Earth and Atmospheric Sciences
School of Information Systems
School of Mathematical Sciences


The Faculty is renowned for its translational research expertise in areas such as climate change, energy, geosystems, food security and water resource management led by world-class and internationally recognised researchers. The Faculty is home to both University and Faculty based Research Centres, including:
Centre for Agriculture and the Bioeconomy
Centre for Data Science
Centre for Materials Science
Centre for Clean Energy Technologies and Practices
Centre for the Environment
Centre for Waste Free World


The Faculty is led by the Executive Dean and the Executive Management Team which includes the Deputy Deans, Associate Deans, Heads of School, and the Faculty Operations Manager.

About the School
In 2018, the Cyber Security CRC was funded for seven years by the Commonwealth Government’s Cooperative Research Centres Program. The CSCRC participants include eighteen industry and government entities and six universities. Research is in two major programs: Critical Infrastructure Security and Cyber Security Solutions as a Service. The CSCRC also supports training and development of Australia’s future cyber security workforce through education programs with university and industry partners; knowledge generation from a range of disciplines to influence innovative approaches to cyber security; and building awareness of cyber security habits and risks.

What you need to succeed
Your expertise and initiative, combined with your ability to work as an excellent team player will be vital to your success in this role.

You will demonstrate:
Completion of a doctoral qualification in computer science, information technology, electrical engineering, or a similar discipline, with a focus on cyber security.
Demonstrated academic research experience as evidenced by publications in high quality research journals and/or high-quality research presented at relevant conferences.
Demonstrated research experience in a relevant area of information security such as critical infrastructure security, network security, machine learning, post-quantum cryptography, quantum-safe communications protocols, threat modeling, etc.
Ability to build proof-of-concepts using C, Python, JavaScript or similar languages.
Highly developed communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively; both independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
Demonstrated ability to develop partnerships and work constructively with a range of collaborators on research projects within time and budget constraints.
Experience at conducting research in both academic and industrial contexts is highly desirable.
Applicants with research experience in information security, cyber security analysis, communication protocols security analysis, quantum-safe communication protocols, post- quantum cryptography, complex system modelling, threat modelling, machine learning and related topics are especially welcome.

Costa is Australia’s leading grower, packer and marketer of premium quality fresh fruit and vegetables.  We nurture our people, cultivate our growing sites, and invest in ongoing research and development.
