Work from home 2-3 days per week.
Data centric organisation with heavy investment in Technology
About Our Client
This organisation is a national leader in the field of pharmaceutical wholesale and distribution. They are investing heavily in improving their operational performance and compliance targets, and the Data & Analytics stream is central to this.
Job Description
Working cross-functionally with data engineering, analytics, and business stakeholders, the Data Engineering Technical Lead will oversee the implementation of data architecture, and lead the modelling, design, development, and implementation of data engineering solutions running on a cloud environment.

Key accountabilities will include:

Ensuring the organisation's Data Engineering platform and products aligns to global best practice in terms of engineering and operations.


Oversee the implementation of data architecture, and lead the modelling, design, development, and implementation of data engineering solutions running on the cloud environment.


Utilising your extensive experience in data warehousing, data engineering, data modelling, and data integration to drive the Data & Analytics function.
Directly be involved in hiring of Data Engineers in the team as they continue to grow.


Please note that while this is a leadership role, this is NOT a people management position. The Technical Lead, alongside the rest of the Data Engineering and Analytics team, will report to the Manager of Data Engineering.
The Successful Applicant
Key skills required include:
Very strong Data modelling skills (including Dimensional and Relational modelling), as well as Data warehouse and Power BI development.
4-5 years Technical Leadership experience of a Data Engineering team, remaining hands on throughout.
Strong in Azure DataFactory (ADF), Power BI, Power Automate, and Snowflake.
Azure DevOps (including developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines) and Github.
Experience with the implementation of Data Governance frameworks, and a good understanding of Data Architectures.
Agile (Scrum Master certification would be a bonus)
Solid stakeholder management experience (both technical and non-technical)
Strong understanding of DataOps and Automation

Nice to have (not essential):
Data Science skills
Python / R / Scala or similar
Bash or Powershell scripting
Healthcare or Logistics (Distribution) industry exposure
What's on Offer
Hybrid work model - working from home 50% of the time.
Highly competitive salary package (up to $180k base plus super) plus a generous annual bonus.
Melbourne office HQ - while the majority of your time in office will be based in Brisbane, occasional travel to the brand new national head office in Melbourne will be required.
People focussed, supportive business that invests in your ongoing learning and development path.
Opportunity to progress into a people management role in future is available for those who are seeking this in their career future.
Excellent work-life balance and employee benefits, including access to leading health & wellbeing programs.

Project Summary
Are you looking to make your mark with a world class, high-impact project?
Keen to join an experienced and highly respected team?
Want to contribute to significant environmental and cultural heritage values?

Then the Energy Resources of Australia (ERA) Ranger rehabilitation project is what you’re looking for!

After more than 35 years operating as a successful uranium mine, the Ranger Project is entering its rehabilitation stage and offers an exciting opportunity for you to make a positive impact on the environment.

ERA has engaged the global engineering firm, Bechtel, to support ERA as Delivery Partner for ongoing study work.

Bechtel will be working alongside ERA and major stakeholder Rio Tinto to restore the land to the status of its surrounding World Heritage listed Kakadu National Park. A collaborative project, this project will be developed in consultation with the Mirarr Traditional Owners and will benefit the Jabiru community.

Located 8 km east of Jabiru and 260 km south-east of Darwin, the Ranger Project will lead the way in the fast-growing area of mining closures.

This is your opportunity to join an established team, develop as a professional, and work in partnership with our client – contributing to a long-term commitment to people, communities and the environment.

Please note a formal offer to the successful candidate of this site-based FIFO (fly in fly out) position will be contingent upon passing a stringent medical examination.

Interested to learn more? Visit: Energy Resources of Australia Ltd (www.riotinto.com); Energy Resources of Australia (www.energyres.com.au)

Position Summary
As our Project ESH (Environment Safety and Health) Coordinator and Onboarding Advisor you will be responsible for providing ESH advice and facilitating, promoting and coordinating activities related to ensuring the health and safety of all project participants is maintained for the duration of the ERA Ranger Rehabilitation Project.

You will champion the onboarding of contractors to the Project ESH site requirements and ensure contractors audits and reviews are scheduled accordingly. Within this role you will continuously contribute to a positive safety culture - leading by example, coaching personnel and providing timely advice and support as required to the contractor and the project ESH Team.

This role will be based on site at the Ranger Mine jobsite offices where you will be assigned on a fly in/fly out roster (2 weeks on, 1 week off) flying to and from Darwin - with a drive to the Jabiru work site - where camp accommodation is provided.

Key Responsibilities (include but are not limited to)
Work with Contracts team to ensure contractors are project ready
Establish the contractor onboarding schedule
Ensure contractor completes all prerequisites in relation to site mobilisation
Support handover to ESH site-based team
Provide technical support for site ESH assessments and project risk assessments including - Level 2 Risk Assessments, Job Hazards Analysis (JHA), review scopes of work for site ESH requirements
Contribute to readiness with timely notifications and actively participating in project 30/60/90-day planning
Contribute & coach improvement of HSE processes and procedures
Support theimplementation of the Contractor HSE plan and ensure alignment in accordance with established polices, systems, processes, procedures and methods and regulations.
Participate in meetings with customers, project team members, and contractors/subcontractors to advise of project-specific mitigation plan, training program, and technical reports
Assist in data collection and interpretation onproject accident investigations; documents factors contributing to an incident and prepares required reports
Supportinspection tours, audits of the project/facility for compliance with project ES&H requirements
Develop cross-training for personnel in professional or discipline-specific skills, techniques, and procedures
Support timely intervention of medical/first aid treatment and ensure contractors have effective stay at work programs for injured workers including alternate work duties.
Contribute to the project ESH orientation and training of project manual/non-manual personnel
Ensure contractor compliance in theimplementation of environmental compliance inspections conducted to monitor compliance with environmental requirements including daily inspections and waste forecast and waste disposal
Interpret applicable HSE standards and supervises implementation into work design and delivery
Complete timely report of contractor HSE performance as per project reporting requirements
Execute other HSE duties as assigned by supervisor, Site Manager, Project HSE Manager, or designated GBU ES&H management.

What we offer
There are many reasons why choosing to join Bechtel is one of the best career decisions you will ever make. In addition to working with talented, dedicated people and having the opportunity to play an integral role in stimulating and rewarding local and international projects, Bechtel is committed to offering employees the benefits and resources to live healthy lives.

With a competitive salary package and annual discretionary performance bonus scheme in place, employee wellbeing is also at the centre of our business - promoted through private health cover and includes access to specialist medical advice (‘Best Doctors’) and a leading employee assistance program.

We are serious about setting you up for success from the very beginning. Experience an established online onboarding process, gain access to learning and development opportunities via the Bechtel University and participate in our Talent Management and Reward and Recognition programs.

Qualifications and Skills
Formal qualifications in environmental and/or safety engineering, process safety, health or related discipline.
Demonstrated experience in construction or mining in a safety role with some experience in supervising small teams.
Working and applied knowledge of HSE sciences/engineering systems, principles, and methodologies.
Knowledge of and experience working within an Australian legislation context (e.g. interpreting and providing advice based on relevant OHS Acts & Regulations).
Knowledge of permitting processes and responsibilities, Industry standards for HSE compliance, and best management practices for minimising HSE impacts during project execution.
Knowledge of engineering and construction systems, methods and work processes, construction planning, estimating, procedures, and execution.
Exposure to project closure or rehabilitation projects preferred.
Offers of employment will be conditional upon successful completion of a medical examination (including but not limited to a functional exam and drug and alcohol testing).

Please note, Right to Work in Australia without employer sponsorship is required for this role.

Australia
Position Description



At Volvo Group Australia (VGA) we strongly believe in a future where sustainable and efficient transport and infrastructure solutions are essential for any society to prosper, where collaboration and diversity increase speed and solve societal challenges. Our solutions improve the everyday life of our customers and for the society at large, today and tomorrow.

The Primary purpose of this position is to lead the deployment of, and continuously improve GTO Wacol Quality & Environmental Management Systems and ensure compliance with the Environmental legislations and Volvo Directives.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Quality and Environmental Processes and System for the site
Lead ISO 9001,14001 and 45001 Management Review Meetings.
Develop and Improve Quality and Environmental Management Systems.
Manage Document Reviews within Systems.
Lead internal audits and assist with external audits for GTO ISO Certification.
Develop environmental objectives and targets and maintain aspects and impacts registers and protocols.
Ensure compliance with environmental legislation and relevant Volvo Directives.
Maintain relevant environmental records (including licenses and permits)
Implement actions from external and internal environmental audits.
Manage the Environmental impacts from Hazardous Substances and Dangerous Goods activities on site.
Ensure all relevant environmental licenses are up to date.
Perform environmental risk assessments for standard production activities, as well as PSM and product projects.
Initiate projects and drive improvement activities related to environmental and sustainability objectives.
Manage clear targets and plans for dealing with the identified environmental issues such as reduction of emissions, energy, water, off-site waste, etc. including good understanding and calculation of economic impact.
Generate awareness within senior plant management, for them to show leadership toward environmental improvements, and to deploy action programs with the necessary budgets, tofind solutions that gain economic benefits as well as improving environmental issues.
Share knowledge of all environmental legal requirements, company standards and compliance analysis.
Keep Enhesa Register of legal environmental and site risk requirements up to date, including action program to ensure compliance in the short term.
Promote use of Environmental pyramid and secure it is understood and used, by all stakeholders.
Identify, visualise, and quantify all major internal and external environmental issues in noise map, dust map, risk maps, environmental load maps, etc.
Be part of GTO/IM Environmental, Quality Management and Volvo Blue networks
Support external Volvo Blue audit, follow up and report status of corrective actions and other ongoing activities
Implement and continuously improve all mandatory and other necessary ISO documents and documentation
Nurture employees on environmental issues and risk management.
Ensure visual environmental standards displayed at right places for all the major issues.
Manage EMAT (Environmental Management Audit Tool).
Mandatory
Tertiary education in Engineering or Science - Bachelor’s in environmental science highly regarded
Working experience within ISO management systems, 9001, 14001 and 45001
Internal / Lead Auditor Qualifications.
Qualifications in Quality Management or similar.
Qualifications in Environmental Management or Similar.
Strong communication skills
Sound computer skills, in particular Microsoft Office.
Ability to motivate, coach and train people in quality and environmental matters.
Sound understanding and practical experience on the Environmental Protection Act and Regulation
BENEFITS
Additional superannuation payments*
Loyalty is valued with VGA Service Recognition Program
A dedicated Health & Wellbeing program including Employee Assistance Program and discounted Private Health Insurance & Dental
Purchase leave policy
Educational Assistance
VGA Scholarship Program
Income Protection
Workplace Giving
Personal Computer Program
Volvo and Nissan Car new vehicle discount
A workplace that offers you the opportunity to do truly meaningful work in a supportive, constructive culture that encourages you to make the most of your talent
additional 1% when you invest with the company superannuation fund.
This role is being offered on a permanent full-time basis. An immediate start is available for the right candidate.

Volvo Group Australia are proud of our inclusive work environment which promotes a supportive energy, and encourages individual growth to create strong teams. We are committed to forming a workforce which reflects the exceptionally diverse customers we serve and encourage applications from all backgrounds.
About us
The Volvo Group drives prosperity through transport solutions, offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers’ uptime and productivity. Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to shaping the future landscape of sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions. Countless career opportunities are offered across the group’s leading brands and entities that share a culture of Trust, Passion, High Performance, Change and Customer Success.
www.volvogroup.com/career.
A new era is here. Technologies such as big data, automation and artificial intelligence are changing the way we look at manufacturing and logistics. Volvo Group Trucks Operations is the organization responsible for truck manufacturing and logistics within the Volvo Group and is shaping future industries.
Volvo Group Trucks Operations encompasses all production of the Group’s engines and transmissions as well as the production of Volvo, Renault and Mack trucks. The organization is also responsible for spare parts supplies to the Group’s customers and for designing, operating and optimizing logistics and supply chains for all brands. Together, Volvo Group Trucks Operations represents 30,000 employees at 30 plants and 50 distribution centers across the globe. Our global industrial footprint offers an opportunity for an international career in a state-of-the-art industrial environment, in which continuous improvement is the foundation. Join our teams as well!

Android Developer

About us:
At M3DICINE, our mission is to create beautiful and intelligent medical devices that capture powerful clinical data and empower health professionals and patients to understand health better. Our first product is Stethee Pro, the world’s first AI enabled stethoscope system.
Stethee Pro is a tool for the passionate. For a new era of medicine. For those who think beyond tradition and outside the box. Those with no regard for the status quo. Who understand that great tools should create new experiences and opportunities at any moment, enabling, empowering, increasing our efficiency and pushing humanity forward. Every great tool leads to a new world of discovery.
Accountability:
The Android Developer is accountable for developing the Android interface to enable M3DICINE’s vision of seamless, elegant and easy to use tools which will assist healthcare professionals to capture and record vital signs, and to share data supporting fast, informed clinical decision making.
Role
The Android Developer provides specialist application design skills allowing healthcare professionals and practitioners to manage and operate Stethee Pro through their Anroid mobile devices and ensuring outstanding customer experience.
Responsibilities

Day to day responsibilities include:

Designing and developing advanced applications for the Android platform
Ongoing testing for robustness and reliability
Bug fixing and improving application performance
Ensure application stability through ongoing optimization and development
Liaise with leadership to support development of requested features in line with product roadmap and design guidelines
Follow M3DICINE’s Standard Operating Procedures and undertake ongoing thorough detailed testing processes in line with 6-week cycle guidelines
Follow best practice development principles to ensure code is easy to amend
Work closely with iOS and Front End developers to ensure uniformity of approach
Develop and maintain test documentation to meet quality and regulatory requirements
Work with UI / UX to ensure consistent best practice user experience

Job Qualifications

Technical skills required:
Demonstrated experience with / Knowledge of
Android studio / Firebase

Skills / Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer science or related field
Hands-on software development experience designing, writing, debugging and testing object-oriented code
Understanding of audio file representation and manipulation
Experience working through application upgrades
Experience with / exposure to highly regulated industry (medical device / aviation etc.)
Strong attention to detail
Clear concise communication skills and strong written documentation
Able to learn quickly and pick up medical terminology
Ability to adapt to M3dicine’s quality and regulatory requirements
Have test driven development (TDD) experience and code review practice with peers
Comfortable to work with M3dicine’s Software Development Lifecycle along with QA and regulatory function
Team player actively engaging with the team to ensure uniformity across the software
Up to date with new, evolving and emerging technologies
Passion for technology with an enthusiasm to play around with new tools and concepts
Ability to work in an agile environment along with QA and regulatory function as part of a multidisciplinary team

Title:
Estimator

Our purpose is, together, deliver Infrastructure for a better tomorrow

.

Join us, on the journey.

We value an inclusive and diverse work environment and are working together to build a culture that embraces each other’s unique strengths and experiences.

Our people are important to

us

and you will play a key role in contributing to the success of our business. We believe in empowering our employees, nurturing development within a culture of trust. We are looking for someone that is willing to step up and build upon opportunities. We will encourage and empower you to work in a way that suits your style and look forward to discussing the ways in which we can build success.

The opportunity -

Flexible location across Brisbane, Melbourne and Adelaide

KBR delivers studies and leads the delivery of a range of important collaborative long terms programs and projects across Australia. Concurrently we pursue new opportunities that will bring great benefits our client’s customers and the broader Australian economy. In support of our commitment to deliver projects with collaboration, discipline, and professionalism, we are seeking the services of a motivated

junior to mid-level

Estimator

to share our journey and realise their own career progression.

Working within a collaborative team of Capital Estimators, Analysts and Program Intelligence professionals you will use your existing skill set providing critical services to KBR’s broad client base. In this unique position you will have the opportunity to grow and learn in a faced paced environment providing value across the project lifecycle continuously improving through analysis of return data.

There is a pipeline of construction projects underway spanning several years, this is a great opportunity for a well-rounded mid-level estimator to progress their career.

The core responsibilities will include:
Prepare and/ or support of multi-discipline cost estimates for projects at various stages and values ($500K to 40M)

Administer the estimating guidelines and through early planning of estimates

Develop cost estimates through either first principles, and/or unit rate techniques for AACE Class 5 to Class 3

Conduct analysis of previous estimates and tender submissions.

Develop or assist others to develop project implementation plans including project delivery methodology and construction schedules

Analyse previous project cost and time data as well as contribute to maintaining benchmarking databases

Conduct estimate presentations and reviews and author detailed Basis of Estimate reports

Who you are

The ideal candidate for this role will have the following experience and/or qualifications

Relevant tertiary qualifications (Associate Diploma minimum, equivalent field experience or time in role).

Infrastructure or Water and Wastewater experience desirable.

Out of the box thinking to drive efficiencies in construction.

Demonstrated experience working in a similar role within a construction organisation or engineering consultant.

A well-developed understanding of construction techniques with water and wastewater experience highly regarded.

A solid working knowledge of project development and execution process.

A developing level of competence in the planning and programming of works and a disciplined approach to your work.

Competent in Excel spread sheeting (Basic formulae and Macros desirable).

Ability to work within a team sharing and seeking input from others.

Experience in standard estimating and cost reporting structures.

Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Sound client facing skills with the ability to maintain and develop client relationships.

Who we

are

KBR’s Infrastructure Solutions Australia business works with customers across the nation to deliver projects that create a better, more

sustainable

and technology-enabled future for all Australians. Through trusted partnerships with our customers, our best and brightest deliver innovative solutions across the transport, water and environment, buildings,

defence

infrastructure and program management and construction consultancy markets.

We are a team of nearly 1000

diverse, flexible,

adaptable

and highly skilled people who provide a wide range of professional consulting services to the private and public sector. Our high-performing teams are digitally connected and geographically diversified to match the changing characteristics of our principal markets and have the expertise to serve our clients’ requirements through the full project lifecycle.

We are committed to social and environmental sustainability and delivering projects with a digital mindset that drives innovation within our business, for our customers and stakeholders.

Our people blend seamlessly into customer teams to help create a positive impact on the communities and environments they seek to improve. Our expertise and adaptability

is

unmatched and continues to meet the demands of tomorrow to help shape Australia’s future for the better.

At KBR, we value you – here’s how

While our people are busy delivering leading science,

technology

and engineering solutions, we’re committed to providing them with a supportive, trusting environment and benefits that enable them to thrive and continue doing what they do best.

KBR has all the benefits of a global organization with a local company feel.

We can offer you flexible and family friendly working arrangements including flexibility with hours as well as your work location. You will receive ongoing professional development and the opportunity to work with technically eminent professionals. Employees of KBR may benefit from up to 8 additional hours of accrued flexible leave every 4 weeks.

Don’t miss out on this opportunity to leave your impact on our society with one of Australia’s leading infrastructure businesses. Apply now and follow us on

LinkedIn

KBR values an inclusive and diverse work environment, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Our hiring decisions are based on the key requirements of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences.

Hexagon is a global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software, and autonomous technologies. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality, and safety across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector, and mobility applications.
Our technologies are shaping production and people-related ecosystems to become increasingly connected and autonomous — ensuring a scalable, sustainable future.
Hexagon’s Mining division solves surface and underground mine challenges with proven technologies for planning, operations, and safety.
Hexagon (Nasdaq Stockholm: HEXA B) has approximately 21,000 employees in 50 countries and net sales of approximately 4.6bn USD. Learn more at hexagon.com and follow us @HexagonAB.

Purpose of Position:
The primary purpose of the Software Developer’s role is to develop software for Hexagon products, contributing to all aspects of the software development lifecycle. The Software Developer will work collaboratively within the Product Development (PD) team and with other departments within the Mining division. As Hexagon’s PD team members are globally located, some work may be required to be done outside of traditional business hours.

Major Areas of Responsibility:
Conducting software engineering assignments alone or in collaboration with the R&D team
Responsible for Hexagon’s desktop and mobile software UI design
Responsible for coding software modules
Responsible for testing software modules
Preparing and presenting technical and/or manual documentation
Delivering work packages to agreed timelines
Contributing towards improving Hexagon’s software development framework
Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems
Maintain clear communication channels with business support functions relative to the role and as per process/system requirements
Interface with external contractors of Hexagon and drive development work done by contractors
Compliance with Hexagon’s Workplace Health and Safety policies and procedures, participation in audits and compliance with instructions given in respect to the health and safety of himself / herself and the safety of others
Other duties as required from time to time.
Desired Skills
Knowledge & Experience Required:
Qualifications and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or similar
A minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in a Software Developer position

Critical Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Coding ability (C#)
Understanding and application of Object-Oriented Design (OOD), Domain Driven Design (DDD) and related software design concepts
Familiarity with Agile software development methodologies and their application in a team environment.
Understanding of the application of Design Patterns to software development.
Software module testing
Sound knowledge of cloud-based development
System architecture design
Ability to write unit test cases
High level of analytical thinking
Strong time management skills to ensure project delivery adherence.
Desire to expand own knowledge and skill set as well as sharing knowledge with other team members
Desired:
Database coding - SQL queries, MySQL, Postgres
JavaScript
Geometry algorithm background
Experience with Android
Travel:
Limited travel required to fulfil the requirements of this position.
Relocation accommodation may be made for top tier candidates
Job Family
Sales/Dealer Management
Employment Type
Professional
City
Brisbane

A career at Arup offers you the chance to make a positive difference in the world. Independently owned and independently minded, we attract a diverse mix of people to work on ground-breaking global projects. We have an ambitious commitment to be the digital leader in the built environment and have digital teams and experts all over the world, who collaborate on world-leading software, data and technology projects and products. Being a global team means we value people with diverse experiences, backgrounds, specialisms, and skills.
Our Digital Technology team are proud winners of the IT Team of the Year for 2021 at the Chartered Institute of IT’s UK IT Industry Awards.
We are looking for a junior EDMS support administrator to work within a dynamic team supporting our essential project platforms and tools that are used by our global engineering project teams across the built environment. Essential platforms types include; Electronic Document Management Systems (EDMS), Common Data Environments (CDE), and the application of Building Information Modelling (BIM).
The global technical software services team designs, delivers, operates, and supports the advanced engineering software and platform used by Arup’s engineers to deliver world-class outcomes to our clients.
You will play an integral role in supporting our project teams across the region that use our cloud platforms such as Microsoft SharePoint, Bentley ProjectWise, and Autodesk’s Construction Cloud platforms.
With supervision and guidance, your primary role will involve working closely with project teams and business leaders designing and implementing solutions that support project delivery, automating and streamlining our operations and processes. You will assist with the day-to-day running and maintenance of Arup’s EDMS solutions combining processes, practices, and tools whilst directly supporting engineering projects and teams. The role reports to the global head of technical software services, based in Brisbane.
"Arup is a firm built on delivering amazing projects and I really enjoy working closely with colleagues in the business to help them get them most out of technical software. It is always a great feeling to know we have supported engineers to resolve any technical issues and ultimately help them meet their deliverables and deadlines. Getting things done is always a team effort, so I’m constantly learning and developing from others.”
Lisa Chan, Australia
You should apply if:
You have a passion to learn new skills in technical platforms and software being used on some of the largest projects across the Asia Pacific region
You have an understanding of, or are motivated to learn how to apply BIM and EDMS solutions on engineering projects
Responsibilities of the role include:
Operational support of Bentley ProjectWise and Autodesk’s Construction Cloud platform to support project and business requirements
Liaise directly with Project Directors/Managers, BIM Managers, and other project personnel to understand complex project requirements, develop appropriate technical solutions
Provide Level 3 support by managing support requests via ServiceNow escalating to vendor support when required
Liaise and co-ordinate with the Global Help Desk and TSS level 1 and 2 support team when required
Collaborate, coordinate, and provide support services to technical software service teams in other regions providing support, collaborating and knowledge sharing
Keep up to date with software products, trends, and supplier changes. Understand the vendors roadmaps, upcoming releases, new functionalities, and capabilities, liaising closely with the Strategic Partnerships team to promote and share knowledge across the business
Be a part of trials and pilots of updates and new technical services to meet the needs of the business
Design, produce and deliver training to the business community
Please don’t be discouraged if you don’t meet every point below – if you meet most, and are strongly motivated by the role, and willing to learn, we are still interested in hearing from you.
Requirements and skills
Essential skills and knowledge:
Experience of working within large multidisciplinary projects for Infrastructure and Buildings clients or experience in the Information, Communications, and Technology industry with a desire to be more client focused
Developing knowledge of BS1192, PAS1192 and the ISO19650 suite of standards is essential
Ability to build strategic relationships with clients, industry peer groups, partners and vendors
Developing knowledge of technical design software solutions (including Autodesk suites, Bentley suites, Trimble and GIS) across all disciplines to be able to advise on best practice, interoperability, integration and workflows
Knowledge of programming languages and the ability to build on these and use when applicable with support from the TSS team
Required behaviours:
Passionate for diversity, recognizing the innovation and competitive edge that comes from a diverse highly skilled team where equal opportunities are truly valued
Ability to solve complex problems and openness in sharing your knowledge and thinking with others
Ability to communicate with people at all levels in both technical and non-technical environments with effective written and verbal communication skills ensuring a high level of customer experience throughout
Strong team working skills with ability to build trusted relationships with people and groups with diverse backgrounds
Education
Recognised qualification in a numerate, computer science or engineering discipline is desirable
The people at Arup are driven to find a better way and to deliver better solutions for our clients.
We welcome applications from a diverse group of people, including those who are seeking flexible working, have accessibility needs, want to bring their whole selves to work, and can enrich our workforce with cultural diversity.
We offer a competitive remuneration package commensurate with qualifications and experience to the right candidate including a global profit share scheme, excellent staff benefits and long-term career development opportunities.
We’ve always been a purpose-led organisation. we are here to support each other, to do our best work possible and make our own special contribution. We’re here to shape a better world, and for us ‘better’ is all about creating a more sustainable future for the world.
If you are interested in helping us shape a better world, please click “Apply Now” to submit your online application.
No agencies please
Stay safe online - Arup will never ask for payment or your bank details as part of our recruitment process.
#LI-WL1

Mobile App Technical Lead
Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. And we’re back (in a big way).
We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. For us, flying is so much more than simply taking off and landing (although we understand that is quite important). It’s about going the extra mile, in the air and on the ground, to create authentic experiences that put our guests firmly at the heart of everything we do.
No matter our role – we are united by our ambition to be the most loved airline in Australia, and always go one step further for our customers, colleagues and our wider community.
Who we’re looking for:
The objective of the Digital Squads Mobile App Technical lead is to be responsible of the technical delivery and platforms of our Virgin Australia & Velocity Frequent Flyer Mobile Apps. The role also extends to leadership of our mobile app squad developers and testers who currently maintain and delivers features in our hybrid iOS & Android apps which is aimed to delight and engage the users experience.
The role would work in harmony with our Digital Product Managers, Product Owners, Business Analysts, Scrummasters & Architects on our product road map, technical & architectural decisions. This role is highly critical to the success of our digital strategy and only strong app development specialists with native iOS and Android hands on experience with strong product leadership will be considered for the role.
What you’ll be doing:
Ensure all activities are managed within established budgets
Ensure that we reduce duplication and encourage re-use and shared environments
Ensure that all projects meet performance standards and comply with relevant safety standards
Ensure all code compliance and CD/CI practices are adhered to
Ensure all security and SDLC guidelines are adhered to
Ensure quality code at scale is delivered by the team writing clean, readable and performant code and ensuring adequate integration and unit tests to ensure a bug-free code base
Provide technical oversight and management of all development resources
Work closely with solution/enterprise architects and cloud engineers to be able to provide up to date and accurate technological advice to the engineering and development and support teams
Translate technology realities into simple terms for non-technical stakeholders
Be the technical point of contact for any mobile app queries
Drive an innovative and passionate team culture that collaborates and is open with all others
Assist development team members to meet day to day operational and project management objectives
Engage as an active member of the team and the broader Department with an achievement orientated attitude that reflects the vision, values and customer focus
You’ll be great in this role if you have:
Degree in a relevant area such as computer science or software engineering
5+ years’ experience with native application development and implementation in iOS Swift and Android Kotlin
Experience leading or being a senior in a team that has shipped quality native mobile apps
Experience in iOS Mobile App development with Realm, Core Data
Experience in Android Mobile App development using Kotlin / Android Studio
Experience working with API consumption experience preferably AWS
Strong analytic, teamwork and collaboration skills to lead discussions and help the team reach consensus
Enthusiastic and passionate with a can-do attitude
High level of written and oral communication skills to assist in management of offshore development resource
Ability to deliver high quality software engineering practices and guidance to team members
Experience with agile development methodologies specifically SCRUM
Experience in working in a DevOps culture and practice including continuous integration, testing and deployment and experience implementing CI/CD practices, tools.
Desirable skills:
DevOps training / certification - Agile training
Eye for design and UX and the ability to work with designers to develop dynamic user experience
Aviation / airline technology experience
Experience in the following (Functional Programming, Java, Objective C and SSO)
Test Driven Development
Migration projects - moving from a hybrid app to a fully native app
What you’ll get from us
We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to):
Heavily discounted air travel for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
Flexible working arrangements (including work hours and work from home)
Discounts on travel insurance, car hire, accommodation and experiences worldwide
Discounted Virgin Australia Lounge membership
Hospitality, retail, technology, beauty services and wellness discounts
Wellness support, including the betterme digital wellbeing platform
A comprehensive Employee Assistance Program, which offers confidential coaching and support from qualified professionals for all aspects of life – physical, mental, social and financial
Dress for Your Day – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever is appropriate for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you
Equality rules
We’re all individuals. We love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.
COVID-19
The safety and security of our people, guests and operations come first. Always. That’s why we’ve put together a comprehensive ‘Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy’. In a nutshell, to work with us, you’ll need to comply with our (and the airport’s) rules and regulations. And be fully vaxxed.
Ready to apply?
We’re ready to hear from you.

The Opportunity

We are currently seeking motivated Veterinary Laboratory Scientist to join our diagnostic laboratory in Brisbane in a Part-time capacity to cover increase in Parasitology and Urinalysis testing. Working 20 hours/week, as a member of a multidisciplinary team, you – as the successful hire, will ensure the provision of high-quality, efficient, effective, and timely diagnostic testing services for the IDEXX Reference Laboratories. The Veterinary Laboratory Scientist will apply professional knowledge in parasitology and urinalysis investigations, as well as, exercise professional judgement in interpretation, verification, and validation of the results.
The Veterinary Laboratory Scientist will ensure that IDEXX Reference Laboratories operate at the highest level of accuracy by performing, monitoring and acting upon quality control procedures – while monitoring, calibrating, and troubleshooting their performance, in compliance with NATA and ISO accreditation/certification requirements at all times.

The Successful candidate will possess:
A Bachelor of Medical Science/or equivalent degree.

Min 1-3 years’ experience within a lab setting – preferred but not essential.

Experience within a veterinary laboratory is highly desirable

PC & data entry skills are essential.

Demonstrated ability to follow and adhere to policies and practices.

Experience in operating efficiently and effectively to meet tight turnaround times in a commercial lab environment.

A passion for providing exceptional customer service

Attention to detail and excellent communication skills.

Commitment to our IDEXX values, diligent attention to our Quality system and Health & Safety policies/procedures.

What we can offer?

Dynamic role providing development and learning in all areas of parasitology and urinalysis.

Experience with varied aspects of the business and scientific skills.

Competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits, while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.

Ongoing health and wellness activities, platforms, and programs.

Ongoing training and investment in its people, including product training and professional skill development.

Most importantly, this role offers you an opportunity to make a difference and positively impact the community alongside a fantastic local team who pursue our purpose with passion.

So, what does that mean for you?

We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.
Let’s pursue what matters together.

If you are passionate about making a difference and being rewarded for your efforts, please APPLY via our careers page – You can also visit careers.idexx.com/us/en/anz or www.idexx.com.au/en-au to learn more about IDEXX. Please email anz-careers@idexx.com for any queries, however you must apply via our careers page to be considered

At Smith + Nephew we believe everyone should be able to live Life Unlimited, free from the burden of managing wounds.
Our Pharmacy division leads an important role in supporting patients’ recovery from Life’s little accidents through to ongoing Woundcare support at home.
Due to an internal promotion, we have an opportunity for a driven, commercial Territory manager to join our successful team. In this role you will have the opportunity to take ownership of your defined territory and customer base and make your own results. You will be tasked with business development and territory planning that deliver outcomes above expectations.
You will be supported with ongoing education on all aspects of Woundcare, selling skills and materials to enable you to succeed. The role will involve developing commercial and clinical relationships with multiple key customers in your stores including Pharmacists, Retail Managers and Pharmacy assistants. A key component of this role is communicating education and some of this will occur outside of regular business hours.
For the right candidate this role can lead to career development paths to Key Account Management, Marketing, Field Coaching or appointment to one of other selling channels in Community or Hospital.
Essential Job Functions
Maintain and develop sales within a designated territory covering both Metro and Regional locations
Target customers for new business development
Provide in-service programmes, workshops and seminars
Attend conference / trade displays / meetings relevant to business development
Work effectively in conjunction with other S&N staff where overlap of territory responsibilities exist
Keep up to date with competitor products and competitor activity
Consult Marketing / Regulatory Affairs Department on field promotional materials
Review powerplay data on a monthly basis, or as required, to actively performance manage key products and key accounts
Education
Tertiary qualifications in Science or Business relevant disciplines ideal, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience
At least 3-5 years of selling experience in a similar role within pharmaceutical and/ or pharmacy
Proven success track record selling within the pharmacy channel
Technical Knowledge & Competencies
Strong selling skills and understanding of the selling process
Strong understanding of the healthcare industry in ANZ
Working knowledge of wound care or related area desirable
Highly focused on exceeding customer expectations
Good planning and execution skills
Attention to detail and committed to excellence
Superior presentation and public speaking skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
If you think you are the right candidate for the role, have a can-do attitude and want to live unlimited through a culture of Care, Courage and Collaboration we want to hear from you today.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Edge Stackers is a privately owned investment, trading and technology company.
We utilise a range of quantitative techniques and proprietary algorithmic systems fused with game theory, to identify and exploit domestic and international market inefficiencies.
Our arms-locked-culture, alongside our robust, repeatable and scalable systems, makes Edge Stackers a place outliers fight for a position at. A place where the meritocratic environment motivates, and capitalising on collective intelligence surpasses titles, ego and hierarchy.
Quantitative Analyst - 99.9% Need Not Apply
Our team of outliers are high-speed problem solvers, humble, loyal and have a relentless hunger to improve. Relishing the challenge of attacking projects few can successfully complete, our team are rewarded with superior compensation, autonomy, long-term growth opportunities and the freedom to shape their role to how they perform best.
We are searching for an ambitious and competitive quantitative analyst, with a passion for high-level, predictive modelling.
Your challenge will be to uncover innovative modelling solutions that enable our team to capitalise on opportunities ahead of our competitors. We are extremely fast paced; the faster we iterate, the faster we can innovate.
The expectations on you will be high. You will have the advantage of an international eco-system of expert mentoring and support, deep domain intelligence, advanced technology, and resources that will enable you to excel in your craft.
You will be a valued member of our team, providing meaningful contribution to the company strategy. You will work autonomously and collaboratively with our tight knit data and trading specialists.
If you have a passion for trading, data science, or data engineering, there is no better time to join our expansion and share in the spoils of superior performance, alongside the psychological safety of a 20-year old proven and profitable track record.
Recruitment@edgestackers.com

Our fast-growing Brisbane office is looking for an Environmental Scientist / Engineer in the Contaminated land area.
Under the direction of our Team Leaders, Principal staff and QLD DES accredited Contaminated Land Auditors, you will be responsible for the delivery of contaminated land management, and remediation projects as well as working directly supporting contaminated land audit projects. Core tasks will include report writing, field investigation and data gathering with an emphasis on data interpretation / analysis and writing internal and client correspondence and reports.
WHAT YOU WILL BRING
To be considered for this position, you will need to possess the following:
Tertiary qualifications from a recognised institution in environmental science, soil science, hydrogeology, geology or environmental engineering or similar relevant degree
A minimum of 2-5 years’ experience in an environmental consulting role with at least 2 years operating in Australia
Knowledge of relevant QLD Environmental legislation and relevant contaminated land guidelines demonstrated understanding of the national technical framework such as NEPM (Assessment of Site Contamination)
Exposure to reporting writing and developing innovative approaches to solving client problems
Understanding & experience in sampling methodologies for soil, surface water and groundwater
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrated team player and able to self-motivate and take ownership of and be accountable for the delivery of contaminated land tasks and projects
Interest to undertake business development and growth opportunities for Epic
OUR VALUES
We are down to earth - We understand where we came from and the people and clients who helped us achieve success. Without judgement we listen to each other.
We create value for our client – We build lasting relationships with our clients and support them to be the best. By listening to our clients we deliver tailored and innovative solutions to their challenges.
We embrace our differences – We believe everyone deserves a fair go and should feel respected in the workplace. By building and embracing a team with a variety of backgrounds, skills and views, we maximise our potential for success.
We never stop learning – We learn together, staying humble and curious. Through our passion for knowledge, improvement and innovation, we grow from our successes and our failures.
We work together – We promote a culture of collaboration, accountability, support and enjoyment. Great things happen when we work together.
We leave a positive legacy – We shape a better world by supporting our communities to become environmentally and socially conscious. Professionally we challenge our clients to generate positive change and outcomes.
EPIC PERKS
Work on challenging and rewarding projects across Australia that contribute to better environmental outcomes
Feel trusted and empowered to take ownership of your projects and provide innovative solutions
Work in a team with highly skilled, certified and respected Professional consultants
Strong commitment to professional development including structured buddy & mentoring system, support for further studies, attaining certification, professional memberships & working with industry leaders
Opportunities to shape not only your career but the direction of the company by involvement in designing and implementing the Strategic Plan
Enjoying coming to work and working in a friendly and welcoming office environment & as part of a collaborative team culture that values flexibility and fun
Regular social events and activities for team building
Employee Assistance Program
Birthday day off!
Don’t believe us – check it out for yourself: https://au.linkedin.com/company/epic-environmental-pty-ltd
NEXT STEPS
If you think you are Epic material:
Submit your CV and cover letter addressing the Epic Essentials to enquiries@epicenvironmental.com.au
State job code BCL_16DEC2022_PRO_ENG in the subject line
IMPORTANT DETAILS
The closing date for this role is 31 JAN 2023
An attractive salary in line with level and experience can be negotiated.
We appreciate all responses to this advertisement, however please note that only applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.
If you have any questions call 1800 779 363 and ask for Charles Kosecki for a confidential discussion.

Ventia require an experience dynamic and energetic Data Engineer with the ability to think outside the square to join their team. Ideally you will be in Brisbane and can work from home. This role will commence mid-January 2023.


About the Role
As the Data Engineer you will develop and manage scalable data processing platforms to support reporting, analytics and data science. You are instrumental in enabling the organisation to access data in a timely and structured way, while adhering to appropriate data governance policies and processes.
Your key accountabilities include but are not limited to:
Data engineering specialisation
Design and implement data engineering standards, frameworks and patterns to ensure re-usable and scalable data solutions
Develop solutions via best practice methodologies; such as DevOps and consistent coding principles
Assist in designing, debugging and optimising databases and ETL processes to ensure optimal performance
Design and collaboration
Continuous improvement of efficiency and process, and engage new technology
Collaborate with business users and data scientist by preparing data / developing end to end data pipelines
Work with business stakeholders to solve complex issues and provide architectural direction on solution design
Deploy data and data science assets
Follow standards and procedures to enable the business to take data science-based solutions through the complete analytical lifecycle (i.e., from prototyping through to automation and production at scale)
Develop data pipelines and processes for data mining, data modelling and enterprise grade reporting and analytics solutions
Work closely with different business sectors to understand their data needs, and develop solutions that support the overall data and analytics strategic direction and self-service access to data assets


What’s on Offer
Access to a variety of Health and Wellness initiatives - including the EAP, Ventia's Healthy Minds program and Healthy Bodies program
Employee benefits such as corporate travel discounts, Novated leases, private health discounts, credit discounts and more
Attractive salary


About You
To be successful in this role you must be able to demonstrate the below:
Qualifications in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent
5+ years’ experience in Data Engineering (deploying data assets using a range of modern tools across a large organisation is essential)

About Us
SMITHS DETECTION MAKING THE WORLD A SAFER PLACE
Every minute of every day, in nearly every country across the globe, Smiths Detection people and technology make the world a safer place. We safeguard people, business and infrastructure with the latest innovations and screening technology for aviation, ports, borders, defense, and security.
What makes us different:
Global leader: We impact critical systems every day with sites in 17 countries and six centers of research excellence.
Digital growth: A key part of our capability is the integration of digital technology across our business and our operations in India, Bengaluru specifically, will be critical to our continued success.
Exciting opportunities: Our growth is creating exciting opportunities to work with experts in physics, chemistry, electronics, mechanics, production, computer science, and AI/machine learning.
International environment: With some projects, work requires global collaboration and the potential to travel and grow with the business
Job Description
As a Field Service Engineer, this individual must be team oriented and flexible, and actively seek to share information and assist his peers. Possesses excellent communication skills, both oral and written. Demonstrates strong repair troubleshooting methodology and maintains at least an intermediate technical level of product knowledge. Ability to read and follow electrical/mechanical schematics to assist in isolating fault to root cause component/assembly. Cross trained on main relevant products in the company’s product portfolio and services them at customer sites. Eagerness to be involved in special projects, some of high profile/value/complexity, and/or in direct support of applicable project lead, as assigned. Performs fault trend analysis and collaborates with relevant stakeholders to develop a solution. Has a sound knowledge of business PC applications (MS Word, Excel & Power Point) and able to effectively use them to provide clear, concise information summaries as needed.

Troubleshoots, services, installs (deploys) and repairs equipment at customer sites. Maintains Service Management System and Teams platform to properly initiate, organize and maintain all field service and job files until work is completed. Demonstrates initiative and dedication through positive use of downtime and an overall willingness and eagerness to consistently exceed customer and company requirements. Conducts follow up calls with the customer to ensure satisfaction of work.
Duties & Responsibilities
What you'll do :
Responsible for meeting daily service needs and driving customer satisfaction
Installs, repairs and maintains equipment in the field; provides customer training as required
Documents all inspections, maintenance, repair work and submits paperwork in a timely basis
Order, install, and return parts and manages repair parts cycle time
Reviews all logs for open issues and prepares formal reports to customers as necessary
Participates in Service sales opportunities and assists with promoting and implementing revenue programs
Ensures that tools and test equipment are properly maintained and calibrated
Assesses product/equipment performance based on field support data; recommends modifications or improvements where applicable
Seeks to provide technical support to customers and other service professionals as required
Possesses a solid level of technical knowledge on the main company’s products in the region
Establishes and maintains a close relationship with senior level FSE’s and Product Specialist in order to support the needs of the customer and remain aware of current technical trends
Exercises every available measure to control and minimize costs
Comply with and ensure department compliance with Company health, safety and environmental policies
Other duties as required
The Individual
What you'll definitely need :
Electrical/Electronics Engineering Degree or equivalent technical training/experience. Equivalence achieved through comparative work and life experience is acceptable (>5 years work experience in a related electrical or mechanical field service role)
Competency in use of all programs within MS Office Suite and aptitude for learning specialized software programs
Minimum of 5 years experience directly involved in troubleshooting and field repair of electrical and electronic systems/equipment
Individuals should possess good communications skills and have a strong orientation for customer focus and teamwork. Must be willing & able to travel at short notice. Must be willing and able to be on-call as per the roster
While supervision is not considered a primary responsibility of this position, there may be instances where supervision of others on a project basis may be required
Possess excellent organizational, communication, interpersonal skills with the ability to multitask several projects at once
Excellent customer service skills and the ability to handle stressful situations
Self-motivated, reliable, and accountable individual
Self-starter, being able to work autonomously with minimal supervision
Clean drivers licence
Ability to acquire and maintain relevant security clearance and industry related licences

Join us for a great career and competitive compensation & benefits whilst keeping the world a safer place.

2023 Digital/IT Graduate
Kickstart your professional career with Origin
Brisbane based opportunity

A great Origin opportunity

Together we’re powering a cleaner, smarter energy future for Australia and beyond, always looking for better ways to deliver for our customers – and for our people.

Good energy starts with you, our great people.

THE ROLE
The Origin Graduate Program focuses on the professional development of recent graduates who are able to adapt to the changing needs of our business, providing you with the opportunity to apply your knowledge in practice with an industry leader.

It’s a structured three-year program, commencing February 2023, which provides discipline-specific learning opportunities including job rotations, mentoring and professional and technical development.

The program will give you the opportunity to gain experience on a range of projects, developing your technical and interpersonal skills to become a future technical or people leader.

IS THIS YOU?
We're looking for talented Digital/IT graduates who work collaboratively, are adaptive to change and are ready to be challenged. You’ll have strong communication and problem-solving skills and the ability to work with a diverse range of stakeholders across both office and site locations.

As a high performing recent graduate (within two years) you’ll have a degree in the related disciplines of Information Technology, Computer Science/Software or Data Science, and be interested in areas such as dev ops, application development, building data bases, automation or cyber security.

You’ll have a strong focus on continuous improvement and innovation, effective interpersonal skills and exposure to leadership through extra-curricular activities. But it’s your passion for the energy sector that will make you stand out from the crowd!

You must hold Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency (PR) to be eligible for this opportunity, and be available to start full-time work in February 2023.
Origin - Where good change happens

At Origin, we’re powered by people who believe in creating collective change. We’re creating more diverse and inclusive workplaces for everyone because the more perspectives we have, in a place where everyone can belong, the better we can tackle our challenges together. We are united, yet unique.

We are committed to fostering a diverse, gender equitable workforce, where all applications are evaluated on merit and potential. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, people living with disabilities, culturally diverse people, any stage in life, people with intersex variations and people within LGBTQ+ communities, including trans, and gender diverse.
If you think you have transferable skills, an appetite to learn and would be a great fit, we’d love to hear from you.

Applications close 8th January 2023.

About our client:
A leader in commercial property who is passionate about property, but it takes more than passion to make them the world’s most successful privately-owned property agency and consultancy.
With a 125-year heritage, they are part of a global property powerhouse dedicated to providing their clients the best advice across commercial and residential property transactional and advisory services.
We champion a diverse and inclusive workplace, where people are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work and are proud to be the real estate industry’s first WORK180 endorsed employer.
The role:
Their Research and Consultancy team is seeking an analyst with strong quantitative skills to help deliver on the teams wide ranging research agenda.
This role will initially focus on Brisbane office, retail and industrial markets but will also provide the opportunity to analyse economic and property investment trends nationally including the growth of emerging property asset classes such as Life Sciences.
The Research team produces a broad range of research and reports and regularly delivers presentations to clients on current market conditions and the outlook.
Key responsibilities:
Regular collection of property market data from internal and external sources
Prepare timely, accurate and insightful reports on the Brisbane office and industrial markets
Prepare market presentations and work towards delivering these to clients alongside senior team members
Contribute new ideas to enhance the impact of our research, including data visualisation
Use analytical skills to assist with existing consulting projects and help generate new business
Build productive working relationships with staff across all service lines
Who we are looking for?
Preferably 2+ years of experience in a research role in property, economics, finance, government, or related consulting services
Tertiary qualifications in Economics/Property/Data Science/Valuation
Advanced MS Office skills, particularly MS Excel
Strong written and oral communication skills
Attention to detail
Knowledge of property research information sources (preferred)
Knowledge of data analysis software – e.g. Tableau/Power BI (preferred)
Flexible approach and ability to meet tight deadlines
Professional, collaborative, and confident
What’s in it for you?
Competitive remuneration package
Flexible working arrangements designed to suit individual circumstances and family needs
A generous 16-week parental scheme plus superannuation for a full 12 months
Birthday and study leave
Swap around a public holiday for a cultural swap day!
Two Wellness Days to allow you to focus on your own physical and or mental wellbeing
A workplace where you can access 2 weeks additional leave each year so you can take that extra break with family or friends
We applaud your need to give back to the community and give you 2 paid volunteer days each year to support one of our-affiliated charities
Our reward platform “The Vault” which gives you access to a great range of discounts at popular retailers and supermarkets as well as lifestyle benefits and corporate discounts
Because life can throw the unexpected at us, we help subsidise private health insurance excess, if you or an immediate family member requires hospitalisation
Plus, so much more!
To apply, send your resume to info@athlete2business.com.au

Long Island Campus
I.T. Services
St. Joseph's University - New York is looking for an Institutional Research Analyst to join our team. St. Joseph's University offers a competitive salary and benefits package including paid time off (vacation, sick time, and holidays), employer retirement contribution
to the 403(b) plan, and tuition remission.
The Analyst assists the Director in performing the functions of the office, which include retrieval, preparation, and analysis of data; preparation of reports to external agencies and organizations; implementation and documentation of new data and reporting technologies; representation at meetings; and other duties as assigned.
The selected individual will work with the Director to maintain a cross-functional data warehouse, data dictionary, and library of key performance indicators accessible to a general institutional audience. The successful candidate will support the Office of Institutional Research and the institutional community as a whole to make data accessible, consistent, reliable, and timely. This position requires an individual with excellent quantitative, analytical and technical skills, who can communicate effectively with both
technical and non-technical audiences.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Extract and manage data files from the university data system
Extract and manage data from external databases, e.g. IPEDS, etc.
Complete compliance reporting surveys to external agents at state (NYSED) and federal (IPEDS) levels, and facilitate the data needs of annual surveys
Work with other operating offices to request and validate key data points, policies, and procedures to prepare the Common Data Set
Assist the Director with special requests for regular re-accreditation and annual updates (Middle States and program-level accreditation).
Participate in the national and university-wide survey administration, data analysis and results reporting including performing data transformations, statistical analysis
and report composition
Oversee and implement the regular collection and editing of data for reporting and analysis
Maintain the library of Institutional Research reports on internal platforms and assist in the regular update of key reports
Attend professional development courses and conferences to maintain the most up-to-date knowledge and skills in data warehousing and data modeling.
Provide training on use of data and production of ad-hoc reports to power users from the institutional community
Special projects and other related duties as assigned
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's Degree in a data driven field (e.g., psychology, business or public administration, statistics, computer science)
Experience with large data sets and relational databases
Understanding of data analysis and experience with statistics
Experience with SPSS
Demonstrated ability to independently learn new software
Proficiency with MS Excel
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience working in higher education environment in a data support role
Experience authoring SQL
Experience writing and editing SPSS syntax files
Experience with business intelligence software such as Tableau and Crystal Reports
Experience working with/contributing to a Data Warehouse
MORE INFORMATION AND APPLICATION PROCESS
Starting Salary: $52,000 - $62,000

Australian Antarctic Program
With most contracts available from 4-12 months, we’re looking for highly motivated people who enjoy working as part of a close-knit team. Bring your experience and skills and you’ll be making a real difference by helping to support climate change research. Apply now and make a world of difference today.
Australia maintains three permanent research stations on the Antarctic continent (Casey, Davis and Mawson) and one on sub-Antarctic Macquarie Island. Each station is like a small town with a diverse and dedicated workforce, comprising station leaders, tradespeople, scientists, doctors, chefs and telecommunications experts. Expeditioners are supported by head office staff experienced in Antarctic policy, law, operations, medicine, technology, science and media.
About the role
As an Electronics Engineer you will install, commission, maintain, calibrate and modify electronic instruments and systems for the collection, reduction and analysis of data. You will have good hardware and software skills. You will be technically resourceful and be able to operate with minimal supervision. You will also produce regular, comprehensive reports on the status of observatory equipment.
The Electronics Engineer is a winter job only at Davis station.
The Australian Antarctic Program’s (AAP) vision is to ensure Antarctica is valued, protected and understood. Working with the AAP provides a unique opportunity to experience Antarctica and the Southern Ocean, while supporting world-leading science.
The AAP aims to support expeditioner growth, professionally and personally, with a focus on wellbeing. We strive to employ versatile, proactive and community minded people. Expeditioners will need to contribute to a small team and be resilient as they face the challenges of living in an isolated environment.
For more detailed information about the requirements of the role and the selection process, please see the job description document and link to more information on the application process below.
Employment conditions
The annual base salary (while in Australia) is $92,076 per annum ($3,530 per fortnight before tax).
Additional allowances totalling $63,437 per annum are payable while working in Antarctica.
A generous employer superannuation contribution of up to 15.4% will be paid in addition to salary and allowances.
You will accrue recreation leave at the equivalent of 20 days per annum pro rata. Please note that recreation leave is not available in Antarctica, but will be paid out on return to Australia.
Contact
For general enquiries, please use our contact form to speak to the Expeditioner Resouring team.
For job specific (technical or trade related) enquiries, or to discuss the role in more detail, please contact the technical supervisor Damian Murphy (03) 6232 3359.
Eligibility
You must be an Australian citizen, Australian resident with work rights in Australia, or a New Zealand citizen. Please note: Jobs requiring a security clearance are only open to Australian citizens. Applications from persons who are not Australian citizens will usually only be considered where there are no suitable Australian applicants.
To apply for this role you must have the skills and licences listed below:
Qualifications/licences (provide copies in your application):
An Engineering degree majoring in electronics from an Australian University, or qualification of equivalent standard from an Australian or overseas university that is consistent with eligibility for graduate membership to the Institution of Engineers Australia.
A current, unrestricted “C” class (manual) Australian driver’s licence.
Recent relevant experience:
Detailed design, implementation and testing of analogue and digital electronic circuits and systems (including microcontroller based systems).
Ability to be resourceful and innovative in technical aspects of the work including the ability to fault find and calibrate modern electronic instrumentation. Have the ability to repair electronic equipment at a component level (demonstrated experience of such when operating with limited resources is desirable).
How to apply
All applications must be submitted via jobs.antarctica.gov.au.

Contract length: 12 months
Salary: $92,076.00 per year

Anonyome Labs is creating a world in which people have exclusive control over their personal data.
We’re changing the privacy and cybersafety paradigm—and resolving the greatest challenges consumers and enterprises face.
Through our products, MySudo consumer app and Sudo Platform business privacy toolkit, we empower everyday users to decide when, where and with whom they share their personal information, and we help enterprises rapidly develop and deploy branded privacy and cybersafety solutions for their customers.
In developing the Sudo digital identity at the heart of our products, we wanted to do something that hasn’t been done before — because that’s what the global fight for data privacy will demand from us all: out of the box thinking and .
If you want to join us at the leading edge of data privacy, apply to join our team now. There’s never been a better time.
We are looking for experienced developers to join our iOS team, responsible for architecting and developing our next generation of Sudo mobile apps for the global consumer market. You will be joining a high powered experienced team, following agile development principles, and who value well-designed software, creative thinking and thrive on solving the unsolvable. You will be working on technology spanning mobile communications (voice, messaging, email), and fintech/payments all underpinned by strong security and privacy principles.
This is a fantastic opportunity to work at a well established global start-up, working with some of the global leaders in the security and privacy space located in our local Gold Coast development lab and US headquarters.

Degree in Computer Science or related field

Passion for solving hard problems

Experience developing with security APIs and technologies
Experience working at a startup

Enhancing Privacy

Sharing Insights
Information empowers our decision making
Taking Ownership
Own it, enjoy it, learn from it
Feeding Curiosity
Always learning
We offer company stock options, private health insurance allowance, cool office space, catered lunches, fun exciting work environment overlooking the beach of the Gold Coast, and the opportunity to learn from leading privacy and security experts with a combined patent filing count of 60+ in the privacy/security area. If you’re interested in changing the world, we’d love to talk to you.
